Rosa, 39, is married to Alí who works in transportation.   She has three children who are 20, 18 and 11 years old living with her in her own house.  The activity Rosa carries out is selling bananas.  She sets up a table every day alongside the store her mother has at home to sell her products to the store’s customers.  She sometimes diversifies her stock with regional vegetables like cucumbers, peppers, lemons and others.  She’s been in business more than four years and to date works alone.  She considers it profitable because she succeeds in selling all the bananas and to earn reasonable profits.  She wants to increase merchandise, therefore.

This is her second Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets to continue forward.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 600 new soles to buy bananas at wholesale as well as some vegetable she wants to put up for sale.

loans.use: to buy bananas and some vegetables.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania, de 24 años, está casada con Sandro de 30 años; no tiene hijos aun y viven juntos en una casa alquilada. Tania tiene una tienda de productos comestibles. A diario acomoda en su refrigeradora sus productos y pone a exhibir todo lo que ofrece, se abastece de las bebidas dos veces por semana. Lleva realizando este trabajo desde hace 03 años y desde que empezó siempre lo ha hecho sola. Además, cada fin de semana vende comida de la región ya que su experiencia y buena sazón le permite preparar las comidas que le soliciten. Su negocio marcha adecuadamente, espera seguir trabajando mucho más y así continuar progresando para mejorar la economía de su hogar. Este es el crédito número 02 con Kiva, está muy agradecida de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas . El monto solicitado 1000 soles, lo destinará a la compra de cajas de gaseosas y golosinas. El saldo restante lo usará para comprar ingredientes usados en la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Tania, 24, is married to Sandro, 30.  They have no children yet and live together in a rented house.  Tania has a food market.  She arranges her products in her refrigerator daily and displays everything she has available.  She stocks up on beverages twice a week.  She’s been in business three years and has worked alone since the beginning.  In addition, on weekends she sells regional dishes because her experience and tasty cooking allow her to prepare the dishes she’s requested.  Her business is operating adequately and she expects to continue working much more to continue making progress to improve her home’s economy.

This is Kiva loan #2 and she’s very grateful to know that she can count on financial support for she’ll feel surer of making work progress.  She commits once more to the punctual payment of her installments.  She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy cases of soft-drinks and snacks.  Whatever’s left will be used to buy ingredients used in food preparation.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, snacks and ingredients.

loans.name: Yelena Del Socorro

texts.es: Yelena, con 49 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio desde hace 30 años, un restaurante que inició en compañía de su esposo y con el que ha logrado sacar adelante a sus dos hijos. Debido a una enfermedad que sufrió su esposo, ella tomó las riendas tanto del negocio, como del hogar, pues toda la carga económica recayó sobre ella porque su compañero quedó impedido físicamente para trabajar. Sin embargo, ella ha sabido manejar la situación y ha sobrepasado los obstáculos y las adversidades que se le presentan, siempre motivada por el amor a su familia y, con empeño, esfuerzo y mucha dedicación ha logrado salir adelante. Actualmente solicita el crédito como apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues desea comprar sillas y mesas, además insumos al por mayor (verduras, granos, pastas, carne, aceite, entre otros), esto le permitirá aumentar sus ventas, pues tendrá más disponibilidad de espacio para que los clientes se sientan cómodos y bien atendidos, mejorando los ingresos que recibe por la prestación de su servicio. Yelena desea seguir trabajando arduamente para continuar sosteniendo a su familia y, en un futuro sueña con tener la capacidad económica para realizar la remodelación de su restaurante, para darle una mejor imagen que le permita atraer muchos más comensales y así aumentar la rentabilidad del establecimiento, lo que afectará de manera positiva la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Yelena, 49, has had her own business for 30 years: a restaurant that she started with her husband and that as allowed her to support her two children. 

As her husband has been ill, she has taken the reins in the business, as well at home, so all of the economic burden has fallen on her shoulders as her husband is now physically unable to work. However, she has managed the situation and overcome all obstacles and difficulties in her path. She is always motivated by the love for her family and with hard work and dedication she has managed to succeed. 

Currently, she is requesting a loan to help her strengthen her business, as she wants to buy chairs and tables as well as wholesale ingredients (vegetables, grains, pasta, meat, oil and others). This will allow her to increase sales as she will have more availability for customers to sit comfortably and be well attended, which will improve the income she receives for her services. 

Yelena wants to keep working hard to continue supporting her family and, in the future, she dreams of have the financial capacity to remodel the restaurant in order to give it a better image and attract more diners, which will also increase the profitability of the establishment and will have a positive effect on her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables as well as wholesale ingredients (vegetables, grains, pasta, meat, oil and others)

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim, 29, is a single man who currently lives with his father in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. He dropped out of primary school because of the family’s financial limits, and then he decided to work to help his parents economically. For nearly two years now, Khim has been working as a driver transporting various kinds of merchandise from factory to local stores in the province, normally earning a daily wage of $10.00.

Khim will use this loan to buy a small truck to provide driving service to two factories at the same time, enabling him to charge higher service fees. Through this investment, he believes that he can generate more income to develop his living standard and help his father in his old age. 

Khim awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity. He thanks lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy a small truck to provide driving service.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is a 53-year-old woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is married with 3 grown children. Her husband works as a carpenter to support their family. Trinidad raises and sells hogs to earn a living and to help augment the income of their household. Her business started 1 year ago. She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed, so the pig will grow healthy and could be sold on time.

In the future, Trinidad hopes to expand her hog raising business and increase the business profitability to improve her livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
A married mother of five children living in the Samrong district of Takeo province, Phal grows rice and raises cows. With thirty-three years' experience in this business, she is able to earn up to $10 per day and keep $2 each day as savings.

Phal joins VisionFund Kiva’s partner this cycle as a first-time borrower. She is now applying for a loan to pay for her daughter’s university tuition. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her child in tertiary education until graduation and also help relieve financial the burden for her family, and thereby she can sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university tuition

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Net, 33, is married and living with her family in a village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has three children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. 

For the last 14 years, Net and her husband have been farming rice as the main source of the family’s income to make a living. Sometimes her husband works for others for a fee to gain extra income. Together, they can earn about 40,000KHR per day from the current business. 

Net is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is asking for a loan of 4,000,000KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. This loan will enable her to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Khanbaji

texts.en:
Khanbaji is 55 years old, married, and raising four children. She has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practices livestock breeding. Her family members help her to lead the husbandry. She sells calves. 

For the purpose of further developing her business, she has applied for a loan in the amount of 800 AZN to buy cattle to fatten them up for resale on the market at a good price. Kahnbaji plans to invest the earnings from the loan into the further acquisition of livestock.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is a 39-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be goal oriented. She operates a tailoring shop where she sells cushion covers, cover nets, etc. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a helpful environment and her primary customers are the general public. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a stock of threads, cloth sheets and other tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a stable financial position within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads, cloth sheets and other tailoring materials.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is 34 years old and married. She has been operating an animal sales business for five years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and sells them during Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She is requesting her second loan for 30,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase two more calves. She hopes to expand her business and provide a better standard of living to her family members through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two calves.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.es:
Doña Priscila de 34 años de edad viviendo con su pareja en unión libre es madre de 6 hijos los cuales están cursando la primaria y la secundaria en diferentes grados de educación que junto a su compañero de hogar se esfuerzan diariamente para que ellos tengan un mejor bienestar, un mejor futuro y una mejor educación. Ella es ama de casa y agricultora siendo este rubro un medio de ingreso importante para su familia ya que por medio del cultivo y siembra de café han podido superarse y salir adelante. Ella en compañía de su conyugue trabajan la tierra de forma propia ya que a pesar de las diferentes dificultades que se presentaron en algún momento pudieron comprar tierra para evitar trabajar ajeno y poder construir un patrimonio para sus hijos involucrándose de manera que ellos también aprecien y vean lo difícil que es superarse de manera correcta y no de forma ilícita inculcándoles el respeto la honradez y la humildad. 

Sus planes son los de seguir ampliando más sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de más tierra y sembrar más variedad, generando más ingresos para su familia y apoyarlos en sus estudios brindándoles la oportunidad que ellos en su juventud no tuvieron. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, foliares, fertilizantes, urea parta poder asistir sus cultivos y lograr incrementar sus ganancias mediante la venta de un producto con calidad.
texts.en:
Priscila is 34 years old, and lives with her partner. She has 6 children who study at primary and secondary school in different grades. Her ans her partner work hard every day for their better wellbeing, future and education. 

Priscila is a housewife and farmer. This activity provides an important source of income for her family, because through planting and growing coffee, they have been able to succeed and move forwards. She and her partner work their own plot of land, since, despite the various challenges they have faced over time, they were able to buy land to avoid working on someone else's plot, and build up an inheritance for their children. This has also allowed them to involve their children, so that they too appreciate and understand how difficult it is to succeed in the right way, rather than illegally, teaching them respect, honor and humility. 

Her plans are to continue expanding her coffee crops by buying more land and planting a wider variety, thus generating more income for her family and supporting them in their studies, in order to give them opportunities that her and her partner never had in their childhood. This is why today, she has requested a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative, to buy agricultural inputs such as compost, foliar products, fertilizer, and urea, to support her crops and boost her profits through selling a high-quality product.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crops.

loans.name: María Bernaldina

texts.es:
María de 45 años de edad, no estudio,  está acompañada desde hace 28 años, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz, frijol, maicillo tienen en común 4 hijos; 3 de ellos estas casados, solo vive un hijo quien se dedica a la albañilería y colabora en casa.  Con ellos viven 3 nietos, a los cuales cuida desde muy pequeños

Ella sea dedica al comercio, desde hace 9 años; decidió emprender esta actividad, porque los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.  

Su negocio, consiste en una pequeña tienda y  un molino nixtamal, para generar un poco más de ingresos. Cuando ella no está en casa, sus nietas le ayudan a la venta de la tienda y cumplir con el trabajo que demanda la molida de maíz
  
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar material para construcción, como: bloque, cemento, madera, polines,  pues una parte de la casa de ella está en mal estado y requiere mejoramiento para asegurar que su familia  estén más seguros. La necesidad a satisfacer, será poder mejorar las paredes de su vivienda y evitar que estas puedan ocasionar algún tipo de accidente.

Ella desea, seguir trabajando en su negocio y mejorándolo para tener la oportunidad de ofrecerle a su familia una mejor condición de vida. Espera que su familia en el futuro, logren alcanzar sus metas, tener la oportunidad de ver crecer a sus nietos, que estudien, se superen.
texts.en:
Maria, 45, does not study. She has been married for 28 years and her husband works in agriculture. He sows corn and beans. They have 4 children together, 3 of whom are married and only one son lives at home and works as a builder. They have three grandchildren living with them, who they have looked after since they were very young.

She has worked as a salesperson for 9 years. She decided to embark on this career as her husband's income was not enough to cover the household expenses.

Her business, is a little shop in and a cornflour mill, in order to earn a little more money. She she is not at home, her grandchildren help with sales in the shop and assist with work in the corn mill.

The loan she is requesting is to buy building materials like bricks, cement, wood and poles as part of her home has fallen into disrepair and requires improvement to ensure her family's safety. They need to improve the walls of the house to prevent them causing an accident.

She wants to keep working in her business and improving it to have the opportunity to offer her family better living conditions. She hopes that in the future her family will achieve their goals and she will have the opportunity to see her grandchildren grow up, study and succeed.

loans.use: to buy building materials like: bricks, cement, wood and poles as part of her home is in a state of disrepair.

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en:
Mr.Ulambayar is 43 years old, and he lives with his wife and two sons in a Ger (Mongolian yurt) in Harhorin soum of Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his wife Uranchimeg have been selling souvenirs in beautiful tourist hot spots during tourist seasons. During winter, Uranchimeg provides tailoring services to local residents.

Their son Ulsbold has just enrolled in the university and lives in the capital city, and their son Suhbold attends a local school.

Ulambayar has been providing souvenir retail with his wife. During the winter he also provides a taxi service business in town. Because the tourist season has not yet finished, he is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Mongolian Tughriks (MNT) to purchase handmade souvenir products from local producers and sell to international and domestic tourists. Ulambayar and his wife are hardworking, positive and welcoming people.

loans.use: to purchase handmade souvenir products from local producers and sell to international and domestic tourists.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom, a 34-year-old married woman, has been in the business of manufacturing jewelry for many years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly everyday. Her husband is a driver, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. 

In order to meet orders on time and boost her sales, Kalsoom has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase raw materials such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She hopes to increase her net income to the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en:
Sumera is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for one and a half years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. By providing the best services, she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetic products for the parlor.  Because of having low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. She needs a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams for  bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She hopes to cater to more customers, time after time.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 34 años, es casada con Josue de 35 años y tiene junto con el dos hijos de 13 y 17 años que viven en una casa alquilada. Hace más de 16 años se desempeña como productora de cacao y café orgánico en unos terrenos que adquirió poco después de empezar a vivir  con Josue, logrando con el paso de los años realizar actividades agrícolas para el sustento de su familia. Todos los días se dirige desde muy temprano a sus parcelas en donde desempeña las labores  como tareas de mantenimiento en beneficio de obtener a fin de campaña una buena producción. Se inició desde muy joven viéndose en la obligación de mantener a sus hijos y brindarles una buena calidad de vida tratando así de enviarlos al colegio permanentemente y esperando que sean  mejores personas. Desempeña su labor con la ayuda de trabajadores para las distantes tareas que considera complicadas tales como el retiro de maleza. Tiene la suerte de contar con terrenos que mantienen en buen estado sus plantaciones de cacao orgánico y barbasco logrando así obtener las cosechas de manera adecuada. Uno de sus principales objetivos es lograr obtener mejores cosechas apoyándose en las propiedades de abono orgánico. Este es el segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas . Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 2,000 nuevos soles e invertirlos en la compra de abono orgánico y plantas de cacao para seguir con la actual campaña productiva.
texts.en:
Ana, 34, is married to Josue, 35, and together they have two children aged 13 and 17 and live in a rented house. 

Over 16 years ago, she began working as a cocoa and organic coffee farmer in some land she acquired shortly after she started living with Josue. She has carried out this work over the years to support her family. Every day she goes to the fields very early, where she begins maintenance tasks with the aim of obtaining a good yield at the end. 

She began very young as she needed to support her children and offer them a good quality of life, attempting to school full time in the hope that they will become better people. She began working with the help of labourers for various tasks that she thought were complicated like pulling up the weeds. She has been lucky to rely on land that maintains her organic coffee and mullein in a good state so she manages to obtain reasonable harvests. One of her main objectives is to obtain better harvests supported with organic manure. 

This is her second loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to continue improving, as well as committing to making her repayments. She hopes on this opportunity to receive 2000 PEN and invest it in buying organic manure and cocoa plants in order to continue with her current productive season.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and cocoa plants.

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1982. She has two sons. Her younger son is still small. Her older son is learning at primary school. Her husband is an electrical worker. Thuy is a chicken raiser and an animal doctor to earn a living. She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for two years. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,500,000 VND per month. 

Her challenges in life and work are the lack of capital to buy more medicines for animals, and the lack of her chickens' output. Her dream is that her children can grow up well and be successful in life. This loan is one of the steps helping her to realize this dream. 

She will use the money to buy more chickens to gain earnings and will save the profits for her children’s education. Thuy is a hardworking woman and a zealous businessperson. She has a passion for raising and taking care of animals. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In this fifth loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,250,000 VND to buy 100 chickens and to buy medicines for animals. She continues to want to expand her business and raise her children up well.

Other members who are part of Thuy's group include the following:

Ly is 41 years old. She has two children. She sells clothes to earn a living. She wants to borrow 9,374,000 VND to buy clothes wholesale.
Phuong is 32 years old. She has a child. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 9,374,000 VND to buy food for chickens.
Tuoi is 45 years old. She has two children. She sells pork. She wants to borrow 8,938,000 VND to buy pigs to sell for pork.
Hai is 22 years old. She has a child. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy food for chickens.

loans.use: to buy 100 chickens and buy medicines for animals.

loans.name: Sey

texts.en:
Sey is 27 years old, married and has a small child. He makes a living by making pestle and mortar from his home and also by working in the construction field. From his hardships, he can generate approximately KHR 200,000 per day, while his wife makes around KHR 100,000 per day from a farming business. Sey has been doing this since 2008. He usually uses it to provide both for sustenance and other living expenses.

This is Sey's first loan with HKL. He aims to use this loan to invest in a breeding cow. Due to the lack of capital, he has applied for a loan in the sum of KHR 1,000,000 to buy a cow. It’s a kind of a long-term investment, but it will bring him a good benefit in one or two year. This is why he is happy and grateful to HKL for its support.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Alexanders Jose

texts.es: Alexanders es un joven emprendedor, trabajador junto a su esposa e hijo sueña con mejorar sus condicones de vida, el trabaja por cuenta propia y tambien cosecha citricos, actualmente dara mantenimineto a unas Naranjas y Limones Dulce para sacar la cosecha en el mes de Diciembre su esposa lo apoya incondicionalmente, con este credito que esta solicitando comprara los insumos y fertilizantes necesarios para darle el optimo mantenimiento a su cosecha. Agradece a Kiva la confianza brindada.
texts.en: Alexanders is a young entrepreneur, who lives with his wife and daughter. He dreams of improving their living conditions. He is self-employed and also harvests citrus fruits. He is currently tending oranges and sweet lemons, which will be ready to harvest in December. His wife supports him unconditionally.  With this loan he is requesting, he will buy the necessary inputs and fertilizers to give his harvest the optimum maintenance. He is grateful to Kiva for the trust it places in him.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia operates a cashew nut selling business which has helped her to assist her family with the profits. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned that the high cost of transportation is her major challenge in the business, and also the lack of enough capital for her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase more stock of cashew nuts to sell. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is married and has one child who is in school. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the family's basic needs.

Mwanamkuu has operated a cashew nuts selling business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbours and passerby.  With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase 2 sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy cashews to sell

loans.name: Fazeelat

texts.en:
Fazeelat is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is a driver by profession and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is the mother of five children and is motivated to provide for her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her second loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour

loans.name: Rani

texts.en: Rani is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her fifth loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
For the last 13 years Margaret has been carrying out mixed farming activities on her farm at Nyahururu. She grows maize, wheat, potatoes and beans, and she also keeps dairy cows which produce milk to sell to her neighbors.

She has applied for her first loan of Kshs. 50,000 from Kadet Ltd which she plans to use to pay school fees for her children, to buy herbicides and to expand her mixed farming activities. The income from her expanded business will be used to buy some heifers and to buy barbed wire to fence her land.

Margaret is 44 years old, married to Stephen who is a businessman, and they are blessed with four children, ages 28, 26, 21 and 13 years old.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children, to buy herbicides and to expand her mixed farming activities.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 40 years old and married with five children. Merlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Merlita has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for five years and also earns an income from selling dried fish.

Merlita aspires to save enough money to build a grocery store at the public market.

loans.use: buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Araksya

texts.en:
Araksya is 45 years old and lives in Vanadzor city. She is married and has three children -- two girls and a boy. 

Araksya and her husband work night and day in order to provide for their children and they greatly wish that all of them will receive a higher education and become educated and clever persons.  

Araksya graduated from Vanadzor State Polytechnic Institute in the department of Machinery, but she has never worked in her specialty. Now she has her own small business of pastries production, which she sells in the city food markets.  Araksya’s husband works as a furniture maker and in this way they try to support their family and also to do some savings. 

Araksya's elder daughter is already a first year student at Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the department of Armenian Language and Literature.  The other two children are still school-aged.  No matter how much money they managed to save, they did not manage to have enough money to pay for her first semester tuition fee.   So Araksya asked for a loan of 130,000 Armenian drams in order to pay her daughter's  tuition fee for the first semester on time.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is 28 years old and is already a very skilled and clever farmer.  He lives in the village of Zovaber, which is in the Gegharkunik region. Vardan lives in his house with his father, his wife and small daughter. His mother died several years ago. Vardan has no higher education and he from time to time does paid construction work in his village. His wife has a specialty in pedagogue, but now she does not work and she takes care of their child. 

Vardan has a small farm where he breeds two cows, ten sheep, six lambs and fifteen chickens. On his plot of land he mainly cultivates potatoes. Vardan has his own hay mowing machine, which has helped him to gather a lot of hay for the coming cold season and he thinks also of selling some part of it.  Vardan has already paid back two loans very successfully to Nor Horizon.

Vardan asked for a new loan of 700.000 Armenian drams to buy four calves in order to develop his animal breeding.

loans.use: to buy four calves

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is 53 years old and lives in Kapan city. She graduated from the School of Music in Kapan city and for twenty years she has worked there as a piano teacher.  Then she became an employee of the post office in Kapan city. 

Susanna is a widow; her husband died seven years ago. She has two sons who are already grown-up and both of them are employed. They work very hard in order to help their mother to overcome their family problems and needs. Lately they have decided to improve their living conditions a little bit.  Susanna asks a loan of 300.000 Armenian drams in order to buy some furniture for their dining room.

loans.use: buy furniture for her home

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 38 year old man. He has one child. He describes himself as ambitious. John operates a shoe store where he sells shoes and bags. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are the general public. 
He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough funds. He will use the 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to add stock of shoes and bags for resale. John's business goal is to be financially stable within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will excel in business. He will plough the anticipated profits back into the business.

loans.use: to add stock of shoes and bags for resale

loans.name: Shilingi

texts.en:
Shilingi is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids.

Shilingi operates a food selling business, making dumplings and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With this KSH 20,000, Shilingi wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy flour, cooking fat and sugar

loans.name: Aminata B.

texts.en:
Aminata lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market in Montserrado County.  She is 42 years old and is married with six children, ages 7, 9, 12, 18, 19,  and 21, who are attending school.  

For two years now Aminata has been operating a table in her community where she sells rice by the cup. She received a little money from her husband to start  this business, and she learned this way of doing business from her mother.  She likes her business because she makes more profit. 

Aminata  is requesting a loan to purchase more rice for her business. She hopes to build a dream house. She appreciates Kiva for supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by bags for her business.

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob is 40 years old and he lives with his family in Yerevan city. He is married and he has two children: a boy 17 years old and a girl 8 years old. His son studies at the college and at the same time he works as a DJ. Hаkob’s wife works as a hairdresser. 

For seven years. Hakob has run his own business; he has his own photo studio nearly with all modern equipment. He does photo and video services of wedding, birthday, and other private parties, he also makes designs, mounting, and color printing. His studio is very popular because of its honor and high-quality service. 

Hakob asks a loan of $2,200 in order to buy some equipment which he needs for his work.

loans.use: to buy some equipment which he needs for his work

loans.name: Rosa Cándida

texts.es:
Rosa de 53 años, estudio Técnico en Trabajo social,  es casada, el esposo trabaja en una institución de Gobierno; ya que es Agrónomo, han procreado tres hijas,  las cuales están estudiando en la Universidad.

Ella posee, un negocio de venta de ropa americana y nueva ya hace 2 años en el mercado. Antes vendía productos de la revista por catálogo, este trabajo de la venta de ropa lo aprendió de su prima, que le prestó el local en el mercado y fue así que decidió estar con este negocio. El mercado le queda a unos 15 minutos a pie de la casa; en este negocio solo trabaja ella ya que por el estudio de las hijas no le ayudan y el esposo que trabaja  no les queda tiempo. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a fundación Campo, es para  comprar más ropa de varón y de niñas; ya que es de esas que le faltan y los clientes le buscan más, pero también pondrá la luz en el local del mercado ya que desde hace 2 meses les cortaron la luz en todo el mercado y tienen que ponerla por individual, esto vendrá a darle más ganancias, ya que esa ropa que buscan la tendrá disponible.  

Su sueño, es poseer un local más grande y un negocio de ropa muy surtido que todos los clientes compren y se vayan satisfechos con lo que  vende  y con las ganancias seguir preparando a sus hijas en las carreras universitarias y que hagan realidad el sueño de ser profesionales, ese es la única herencia que les dejara, manifiesta Rosa.
texts.en:
Rosa, 53, studies social work. She is married and her husband works for a government institution as he is an agriculturist. They have three daughters who are studying at university.

She has a new American clothing retail business and has been working at market for 2 years. Previously, she sold products from a catalogue. She learnt the clothing sales business from her cousin her rented her a stall in the market and this was how she decided to start in this business. The market is a 15 minute walk from her home. She works alone as her daughters are studying and her husband works so they do not have time to help her.

The loan that she is requesting from fundación Campo is to buy more clothing for men and children as she is lacking these and they are want her customers ask for the most, but also to display they at her market stall as two months ago they ran out of stock and have had to be ordered individually. Stocking these products will give her more income, as she will have the clothes the customers are looking for available.

Her dream is to have a bigger store and a well stocked clothing business with lots of customers buying and going away satisfied with the stock. With the earnings she wants to continue supporting her daughters through their university courses and help them achieve their dreams to become professionals. This is the only inheritance that Rosa says she will leave them.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for men and children; as she is lacking these and they are want her customers ask for the most, but also to display they at her market stall as two months ago they ran out of stock and have had to be ordered individually.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
This group was formed in 2010 and is made up of women with a strong desire to follow ID-Ghana policies. They maintain strong relationships among themselves and help each other; they have all lived in the same neighborhood for many years. The women's principal business is selling beads, ladies shoes, slippers, mobile phone credits, foodstuff, and beauty products. 

Margaret, 36 years old,  (standing third from left with hand in corn) is the featured borrower of the group. She is divorced and is the mother of two children, one boy and one girl. She is in the business of selling corn. With her new loan amount of GHS 1000, she plans to purchase two bags of corn and sell in one week. The profits will allow her to increase her savings and allow her to qualify for larger loans in future loan cycles, and also to take care her children.

Margaret together with other friends will need GHS 4400 to be able to buy enough items and sell to customers.

loans.use: buy corn to sell

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en:
Safiya is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of a beauty parlor for two years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

Safiya needs to service more customers. For this, she requires more hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.  So she applied for a loan of RS 35,000 through Kashf Foundation.  

Safiya is in her 2nd loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and is confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: buy beauty care products

loans.name: Ramzan

texts.en:
For the past nine years Ramzan, age 42, has been selling milk from her four buffalo to many of her neighbors. Her business is good enough to enable her to lead a decent life. 

Ramzan has seven children, three of whom are school going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet their day-to-day expenses.

Now in her seventh year with Kashf Foundation, she is happily running her business through its support. She has requested a loan of Rs 60,000 to purchase another buffalo. She hopes to increase her milk production capacity to generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronica is 40 years old and a single mother of 3 children. She runs a clothing sales business in Oloitoktok town. She also sells curtains. She has been in this business for 2 years and her monthly income is about 3,000 Kes. 

This is her second loan term and she intends to purchase more stock of clothes and curtains and expand her business. She will use the anticipated income to educate her children. 

Her hopes for the future are to buy her own plot of land.

loans.use: To buy clothes and curtains.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
Mohira is a kind and hardworking woman. She is married with 3 children. Being a responsible mother, Mohira works hard every day to generate income so that she can cover her daily costs and send some of her children to school. 

She is dedicated to her farming business, growing wheat on her own land. In order to contribute to improving her family's living standards she has worked hard from early morning till late evening for 7 years.

Mohira would like to develop her business, which is why she is asking for a loan in the amount of 6,500 Somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season. She hopes that KIVA lenders won’t reject her loan and she thanks lenders in advance for their generosity.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season.

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Huong was born in 1987. She has two children who are learning at primary school and kindergarten. Her husband is a construction worker. His income is about 3,000,000 VND per month. Huong sells shoes to earn a living. She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for five years. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. 

Her challenge in life and work are the lack of capital to buy shoes wholesale. Her dream is that her children can go to school and that she can buy more equipment for her house. This loan is one of the steps helping her reach this dream. She can invest in her shoe shop to gain earnings and save profit for her children's education. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy shoes for her shop. She continues to want to expand her business and raise her children up well.

Other members who are part of Huong's group include the following:

Doanh is 28 years old. She has two children. She is a grocery seller. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to sell groceries.
Thuy is 22 years old. She has a child. She is a grocery seller. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to sell groceries.
Dung is 29 years old. She has two children. She is a tailor. She wants to borrow 8,938,000 VND to buy fabric.
Tu is 52 years old. She has three children. She sells clothes to earn a living. She wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy clothes wholesale.
Huong is 30 years old. She has two children. She sells clothes to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy clothes wholesale.

loans.use: to buy shoes for her shop.

loans.name: 11-03-01 Trường Thi Group

texts.en:
Ms. Tới has a business of taking care of children. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment for her child care service.

Tới is 63 years old and she is single with two children. She is the group leader of the 11-03-01 Trường Thi solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

This is Tới's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in her business for 5 years. The main hardship that Tới faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tới hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to remodel her house, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her child care service.

loans.name: 04-05-06-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thảo operates a food stall/restaurant, selling soup. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. The main hardship that Thảo faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is 54 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent. Another child is grown up.

In 2009, Thảo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice and pork to make food to sell. With her business profit, Thảo hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

Thảo is the group leader of the 04-05-06-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 5 members.

loans.use: to purchase rice and pork to make processed food.

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en:
Lorpu lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado County. She is 34 years old and unmarried, with four children between 2 to 16 years old, who live at home. Only three of the children are attending school. 

For the past six years, Lorpu has been selling pepper, rice, oil, vita, salt, etc. in the local market. One of the problems she faces is low income. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes every time. 

Lorpu is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, rice, oil, vita, salt, etc. for her business. 

In the near future, Lorpu wants to build a house for her children. She thanks the lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice, oil, vita, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ningumaye

texts.en:
Ningumaye is married and has two children who are adults. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a food selling business, making dumplings for sale. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar for food preparation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar for food preparation.

loans.name: Francisco Wilberto

texts.es: El señor Francisco labora para la alcaldia del municipo, su esposa le apoya incondicionalmente conlos gastos del hogar ya que trabaja como domestica, el continua con su sueño que es terminar de construir su casa con este credito seguira comprando materiales como bloques, cemento, arena. ya que el desea poder darle asus hijos y esposa mejores condiciones de vida .
texts.en: Francisco works for the town's mayoral office.  His wife helps him unconditionally with the household expenses as she works as a housekeeper.  His dream is to finish building his house.  With this loan, he will continue purchasing material such as bricks, cement and sand, since he wishes to be able to provide his children and wife with better living conditions.

loans.use: purchase construction materials

loans.name: Gulsunoy

texts.en:
Gulsunoy is a farmer who has a plantation. She is a well-bred person and has a lot of knowledge as she was one of the best pupils at her school. She has been in an agricultural business since 1998. She sells her agricultural products at the local market. She has a lot of clients who prefer her goods because she grows vegetables of good quality. Her husband helps her to manage the business. They have 4 children. 

Gulsunoy and her family live in an old house which is in bad condition. She is going to repair her house. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy building materials such as cement and wood. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and wood.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 25 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have one child. He sells eggs and has been in this business for 5 years. 

He gets a monthly income of about Ksh.10,000 and will use the loan to buy more eggs for selling in his business. This is his 3rd loan term and he will use his anticipated profits to open another egg sales shop. 

His future hopes and dreams are to become a large scale supplier of eggs.

loans.use: To buy more eggs for selling.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. A year ago, she began stitching clothes in her community. Her daughter also assists her in completing the orders of her customers on time. To cope with the increasing demands of her customers, she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials including cloths, threads, laces, and zippers in different colors. It will help her to stitch up more dresses on time. She is currently in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloths, threads, laces, and zippers in different colors.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of animals sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & sheep) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them around the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently, she is requesting a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase two more sheep. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better standard of living to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more sheep.

loans.name: Candelario

texts.es: Candelario, tiene 35 años de edad, trabajaba en una empresa privada pero al quedar sin empleo decidió con su esposa poner un negocio de pulpería para vender productos alimenticios como harina, azúcar, churros, pan de toda clase, dulces, granos básicos y otros. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace tres años y ha sido la fuente de ingresos para el hogar. El préstamo que solicita es por 12,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en el negocio para surtir de productos como granos básicos, azúcar, pan, churros, refrescos, etc. Su plan es mantener surtido el negocio para obtener mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Candelario is 35 years old.  He used to work for a private company but when he lost his job he decided to start a grocery store with his wife to sell such food items as flour, sugar, chips, all types of bread, candy, staple grains, etc. He has had this business for three years and it has been the source of income for the household.

The loan he is requesting is for 12,000 Lemprias and he will invest it in the business to stock up on products such as basic grains, sugar, bread, chips, soft drinks, etc.  His plan is to keep his business well-stocked so he can increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy staple goods such as grains, sugar, bread, chips, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is single with three children, two of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a retail shop from the market. She sells her goods to all kinds of people on both a retail and a wholesale basis. She has been in this business for 6 years. She works seven days a week.  She gets additional income from selling piped water. 

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy sugar, beans, rice, flour, cooking oil and boxes of soap. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked retail shop and also building rental houses. She resides in a rented house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent for the shop.

loans.use: To buy more beans, rice, flour, cooking oil and boxes of soap.

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en:
Samorn is married and 47 years old. She is from a family comprised of seven members, who are all living in the Bakan district of Pursat province. She has been a rice farmer for nearly 23 years with full support from her husband and children. Normally, she is able to generate a net profit of about $4.24 per day, which she uses to cover her living costs and provide allowances for her two school-aged children.

At the moment, she is taking out a loan to build a latrine for the household as it is very important for her family members. Through this, she can improve their health and also help lessen environmental deterioration. She is very grateful for the loan distribution that will help improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to build a latrine for the household.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 43 years old and runs a poultry-selling business. She is married and, together with her spouse, she has three children. She sells the chicken and eggs to various customers, and she has been in this business for nine years. She makes a monthly income of 5,400 Kes. Besides the poultry business, she also plants cash crops on her farm.
This will be her first loan term, and she plans to use the amount to buy more chickens and chicken feed. She also plans to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting. She will use the anticipated income to educate her children by paying their school fees.
In the future, Rose hopes to open a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more chicken and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stocks of watches, padlocks, and other items.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki operates a food stall business, selling goods at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in her business. 

With Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice and soaps for her business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future and she appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice and soaps for her business.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community. She offers various items and goods for everyday use. She has good communication skills and counts a good client list. Her husband is working as a labor and earns insufficient income to support his family alone.

She is a mother of five children, and is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a stock of detergents and grocery items such as grains, sugar, etc. in large quantities to meet with the increasing demands at her store. 

She wishes to spend part of revenues to deal with the expenses of her children’s education and increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of detergents and grocery items, such as grains, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 31-year-old married woman. For the past two years, she has been successfully running a business of selling milk to the people of her community. She has one buffalo. She has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 
 
She is loving mother of four children. Her husband works as a mason, and earns insufficient income to support the needs of the family members alone. In order to inflate her sales, Nasreen needs to purchase another buffalo. For this, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000.

She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Gayrat

texts.en:
Gayrat is 20 years old. He is a very clever boy. He graduated school with excellence and good marks. He was one of the best pupils in his school. He likes math, computers, geography and other subjects. His classmates like him very much. 

Two years ago he entered to the Khujand State University, the Department of Accounting and Audit. His parents are farmers. Their income is too small to pay for Gayrat’s studies at the university. Gayrat wants to be one of the best auditors in his town. He is purposeful and hardworking. He is asking for a loan to pay for studying at the university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for his education.

loans.name: Dildora

texts.en:
A wonderful woman by the name of Dildora lives in a house which is in bad condition. Her husband is a kind man who is a migrant in Russia. They have 4 clever children. They are non-adults. Dildora’s children want to live in a house which is in good condition but her income from sewing national dresses is not enough for it. She must to repair all the rooms of her house. 

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to repair her house. In this way she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing the house.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en: Mwanalima is divorced and has two children, both of whom go to school. She has operated a cashew nuts selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passerby. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase 2 sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is married and has four children, two of whom attend school, and the others are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a utensils lending business. She lends from home to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase 3 ovens, plates, and cups for the business. She joined Yehu to acquire loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 ovens, plates, and cups for the business.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania tiene 53 años, esta casada con Paulino con quien tuvo 4 hijos que son ya mayores e independientes.
Posee una vivienda construida a base de adobe donde vive únicamente con su esposo. Epifania se dedica a la agricultura por está razón siembra productos como el cacao, café, barbasco; entre otros. Se dedica a esta labor hace más de 35 años y desde sus inicios fue su principal sustento económico ya que logró así mantener a sus hijos económicamente. Cuando empezó a desarrollar este oficio comenta que los productos que ahora cultiva no tenían una buena demanda por estar ubicada en la selva abandonada por las inversiones capitales, sin embargo con el paso de los años y apoyo del estado y empresas privadas ha logrado incrementar sus ganancias al igual que otros agricultores de su zona con el ingreso de compradores directos y entidades que se dedican integralmente a la captación de productos netos de su región. Le agrada mucho su trabajo puesto que es una actividad que desempeño casi toda su vida tratando de obtener en cada campaña una buena calidad de sus productos.  Uno de sus principales objetivos es lograr construir su vivienda a base de material noble ya que espera dejarles así a sus hijos una herencia material en beneficio de sus nietos a quienes quiere mucho. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico al por mayor y sacos para guardas los granos secos de cacao.
texts.en:
Epifania is 53 years old. She is married to Paulino, with whom she had 4 children, all of which are older and independent.

Epifania has a home of adobe where she lives only with her husband. She works in agriculture, and she plants products like cacoa, coffee, and barbasco [an inedible yam used in making synthetic hormones] among others. She has been doing this work for 35 years, and from the beginning, it has been her principle economic foundation, with which she managed to support her children economically. 

When Epifania started to develop this trade, she says that these crops were not in demand because they were located in the jungle, neglected by capital investments. However, with the passage of time, support from the state, and private companies, she has managed to increase her earnings like other farmers in the area, with the income from direct buyers and entitites that deal wholly with the capture of the region's net products.

Epifania is pleased with her work, which she has done almost all her life, trying to obtain good quality products each season. One of her main objectives is to manage to construct her home with superior materials, which she hopes to leave as a legacy for her children in the benefit of her grandchildren who she loves very much. 

This Epifania's second loan with Kiva, and she is very grateful for the financial support that she receives to keep going forward, and further, she promises to pay her dues on time. This time she hopes to have 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase wholesale organic fertilizer and sacks to store the cacao beans.

loans.use: Purchase organic fertilizer and sacks for storing cacao.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 27 years old and lives with his three brothers and his parents. Ibrahim, his father, and two of his brothers provide the family income.

Ibrahim owns a gym. In 2010, he established his business and grew fast in fame and experience. Now, Ibrahim has an employee hired and is being well-known in the surrounding area and has gained an excellent reputation.

Ibrahim is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 US dollars. He will use this loan to buy two new air-conditioners and a television. Ibrahim believes that this loan will help him attract more customers and thus enhance his current financial conditions.

loans.use: to buy two new air conditioners and a television.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is from Iraq. He is a youth client of 27 years of age who is married and a father of 2 children. Thaer is the sole provider in the family.

Thaer owns a shop where he repairs motorcycles and sells spare parts. He has been practicing this business since 2009, and has gained much experience in this field. He now has an employee hired, and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Thaer is applying for a youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his shop, and install a signage and a rolling shutter. Thaer aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide better life conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop, and install a signage and a rolling shutter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 38 years old and the single mother of one child.

She has a grocery business in Naivasha that she has been running for five years.  She has applied for a first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to purchase stock, such as bananas, oranges, and tomatoes, among other items. With the anticipated profit, she plans to boost her business and also pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to open a bigger grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy bananas, oranges, and tomatoes, among other items.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 35-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. He practices farming and has a private school where he earns extra income. Unpredictable weather changes and high cost of operations are his major challenges, while his dream is to expand his school to accommodate more students.

A good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the university, and expand his farming activities. Robert intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mialii

texts.en:
Mialii is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

she operates a food-selling business, making dumplings from home to sell to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour and cooking fat for her food preparation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and cooking fat for her dumplings.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn lives in New Kru town. She is 38 years old and single with two children, aged four months and 18 years old. Her first child is in school, and they all live at home. For the past five years, she has been operating a table where she sells freezing chicken and fish. She says sometimes business is slow.  She started this business by selling in the communities with the little goods she could afford and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more freezing chicke, and fish for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more freezing chicken and fish for her business.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es:
Constantina tiene 37 años, es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos que viven con ella en su casa hecha de adobe. Su actividad principal es la agricultura y venta de granos cacaoteros que produce en su terreno de 3 hectáreas.
Se inició cuando tenía 18 años y no contaba con un oficio estable, fue entonces que al tener su primer hijo se empezó a dedicar integralmente a su actual oficio contando con el firme apoyo de su ex esposo. Al empezar con esta labor necesitaba dinero para comprar abono, herramientas y pago a los trabajadores que fue contratando para instalar sus primeras plantaciones de cacao, logrando recibir un apoyo de sus padres para solventar diversos gastos.Para lograr obtener una calidad deseada de almendras debe realizar una rutina con tareas de mantenimiento como es el retiro de maleza y corte de tallos defectuoso. Al finalizar cada campaña productiva vende sus granos secos de cacao a los comprandores del lugar esperando recuperar el dinero que invierte.
Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con S/.1000 soles para la compra de abono orgánico y herramientas de cultivo.
texts.en:
Constantine is 37-years-old, divorced, and has three children living with her in her house made out of adobe. Her main job has to do with agriculture and selling  cocoa beans produced in a land of 3 hectares.

It started when she was 18-years-old and did not have a stable job.  It was right after having her first child that she began to devote fully to her current job having strong support from her ex-husband.

At the start of the job, she needed money to buy fertilizer, tools, and money to pay the workers that were hired to set up the first cocoa plantations, managing to receive support from her parents to pay for various expenses. To get  high quality cocoa beans, she must perform routine maintenance tasks such as removing badly cut stalks and weeds. At the end of the harvest season, she sells dried cocoa beans to the buyers of the place hoping to recover the money that she invested.

This is her first loan with Kiva and she's grateful for the financial support received to move forward. In addition, she agrees to pay her dues on time. At the moment, she would like to receive 1000 soles so that she can purchase organic fertilizer and farm tools.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and farm tools.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas de 27 años, esta casada con Carlos y tiene 2 hijos pequeños con quienes vive en una casa construida a base de adobe. Desde joven Felicitas se desempeño en actividades agropecuarias concernientes al cultivo de café  y cacao orgánico. Lleva más de 8 años en este rubro y hasta hoy ha logrado desarrollarlo al punto de convertirlo en una buena forma de generar ingresos para el sustento económico de su familia. Considera su oficio como un trabajo tranquilo y a la vez le permite pasar más tiempo con su esposo quien le brinda un gran apoyo. Tiene la suerte de contar con terrenos muy fértiles que le permiten obtener una buena producción no obstante a tenido que lidiar con el ataque de algunas plagas que tratan de perjudicar su producción y para ello debe estar muy atenta con sus cultivos. Para un mejor desarrollo de su labor y llevar una producción orgánica trata de usar únicamente abono orgánico recibiendo a la vez capacitación constante por parte de entidades agrarias. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico para así nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 27 years old.  She is married to Carlos and has 2 small children with whom they live in an adobe house. She has worked in agricultural activities related to growing organic coffee and cacao since she was young.  She has been doing this for more than 8 years and has managed to develop it into a good source of income to provide for her family's economic needs. She thinks of her trade as peaceful work and at the same time it allows her to spend more time with her husband who gives her a lot of help. 

She has the good fortune to have very fertile land which yields good production in spite of the fact that she has had to battle insect attacks which threatened her production.  Because of this she has to always be vigilant of her crops. To better develop her work and to have organic products, Felicitas tries to use only organic fertilizer while receiving constant training by agricultural entities.

This is her second loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she is receiving so she can get ahead. She pledges to pay her loans back on time. At this time she would like to borrow 1,000 new Soles to buy organic fertilizer to feed her crops

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora tiene 29 años, está casada con Edgar y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Flora se dedica a la agricultura en sus terrenos de 2 hectáreas que compró con el apoyo de sus padres y su esposo esperando así mantenerse económicamente. Se inició en esta labor porque desde muy niña ayudaba a sus padres en el campo y logró aprender a cultivar la tierra, es por ello que al tener la responsabilidad familiar se inició junto a su esposo en este actividad económica muy rentable en su región. Desde que empezó a obtener sus primeras cosechas ha tenido la suerte de contar con parcelas que brotan cacao orgánico de calidad, no obstante para optimizar su producción suele usar abono orgánico. Una de las tareas que considera algo complicadas es el retiro de maleza ya que es necesario tratar de mantenerla libre de estas evitando que consuman los nutrientes esenciales para sus cultivos; es por ello que contrata trabajadores del lugar para la respectiva limpieza de manera periódica. Al finalizar la respectiva campaña productiva que dura aproximadamente un año, lleva sus productos en sacos especiales hasta los centros de venta de su localidad en donde finalmente recupera su inversión. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasion desea contar con S/.2000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en: Flora is 29 years old and is married to Edgar. They have 3 children with whom they live in their adobe house. Flora is in agriculture, and farms the 2 acres that she bought with the help of her parents and her husband, hoping in this way to sustain herself economically. She began this work because since she was a little girl she helped her parents in the countryside and learned to cultivate the land. Having  family responsibility, she began together with her husband in this very profitable economic activity her her region. Since she began to obtain her first harvests, she has had the luck of having plots that sprout quality organic cocoa. To optimize her production she often uses organic fertilizer. One of the tasks she considers complicated is removing weeds as it is necessary to try to keep them from consuming the essential nutrients of her crops. It is for this reason that she hires seasonal workers to do periodic cleaning. At the end of the production season that lasts approximately a year, she brings her products in special sacks to the sale center of her town where she finally recuperates her investment. This is her second loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that she receives to move forward. She also promises to make her payments in a punctual manner. On this occasion she would like 2000 nuevos soles to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a 34-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be enterprising. He operates a retail business where he sells handbags. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a potential area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add a stock of hand bags. His business goal is to open a boutique within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of hand bags.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 35 years old and married to Josephine; together, they are blessed with one child of four years.

Solomon has a retail shop in Naivasha, which he has been running for six years, with an average monthly income of KES 30,000. He has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable him to purchase buckets, basins, jags, etc. With anticipated profit, he plans to re-stock his business.

In the near future, he hopes to see his business grow to a higher level.

loans.use: to buy buckets, basins, jags, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and has seven children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past seven years, she has operated an open air food stall business. Her potential customers are market dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality of products in the market.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour, and rice.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
This is Sonia. She previously accessed a loan of 18,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which she used to buy quantities and varieties of bags and materials for her tailoring business. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the materials needed in her business as well as in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of bags to expand her product inventory. The more items displayed the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps her to believe more in God’s love for mankind. The Bible sharing allows her to learn more about the life of God. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for bags needed in her business.

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is 28 years old, married, and together they are blessed with three children who are in school.

He has a kerosene business in Naivasha, which he has been running for eight years with an average monthly income of KES 25,000. 

He has applied for a second loan from Kadet Ltd., after paying back his previous loan successfully, to enable him to purchase fuel for sale. With the anticipated profit, he plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, he hopes to own a fuel station in maai mahiu market.

loans.use: to buy kerosene.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is a 24-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. He practices farming and earns a salary as a civil servant in order to support his growing family. Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation affect his yields, while his dream is to venture into modern farming methods. 

Bosco intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers, for his garden.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers, for his garden.

loans.name: Raqia

texts.en: Raqia, age 50, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses.
