For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 15,000 PKR (Pakistani rupee) to purchase another calf. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Daniel is a first-time borrower applying for UGX 2,000,000. He is married, aged 39 years, and the father of four children. He stays with his family in a rented house in the outskirts of the capital city of the country.

Daniel drives a commercial truck for his boss.  It is from what he is paid that enabled him to save some money and purchase land. 

On the land he purchased, he managed to put up a small residential house that he would like to occupy with his family. He got financially constrained when building the house.  Thus he is applying for the loan to have the house complete.

Given the loan, he hopes to complete, then occupy, his house, hence no longer having to pay rent.

loans.use: To complete his house

loans.name: Mialii

texts.en:
Mialii is a married woman; she has five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her one school-going child.

She operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she sells juice to supplement her income. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the 50,000 KES (Kenya shillings) loan, she wants to purchase six sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Asina

texts.en:
Asina is a hard-working woman who is working hard to improve the living standards of her family. She appreciates the previous loan that helped her support her children, and family in general.

Here again, she comes requesting another loan of KES 25,000 to purchase more wheat flour and cooking oil for food preparation to ensure business continuity.

loans.use: to purchase more wheat flour and cooking oil for the food preparation.

loans.name: Parvin

texts.en:
Pavin is a first time borrower of Ugafode Microfinance Ltd applying for a loan of UGX 1,000,000. She is a university graduate who has thought of employing herself instead of being employed. She began selling ladies’ clothing along one of the streets of Kampala for survival, since she failed to get a job. She started with only UGX 500,000 which she got from a relative in 2011. Now her capital has grown to UGX 2,000,000.

Her major challenge is small working capital that has always let her down in meeting her clients' demands. To have this problem solved, she is applying for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to boost her business by buying more stock that will eventually enhance her sales and thus increase her profits

Pavin’s dream is the continuous growth of her business and achieving her set targets, like purchasing land and having commercial structures built on it in the next two years.

loans.use: To buy used clothing for resale

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette lives in New Kru town. She is 25 years old, and stopped her education at 4th grade. Antoinette has two children, ages 9 and 5, who are in school and living at home. 

For the past five years, she has been selling cassava, plantains, eddo, cow-skin, and gravy around the communities from a tube. She started this business with money from her husband, who is a local businessman, and learned this way of selling from her mother.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cassava, plantain, eddo, cow-skin, pepper, vita, coal, etc. for her business. Her plans are to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, plantains, eddo, cow-skin, pepper, vita, coal, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 47 years old and a poultry farmer from Nyahururu.  She is married to John, who is a businessman, and together they are blessed with three children, aged 30, 27, and 20 years old.

She has been operating a business of poultry farming for the last ten years, and from it she makes a monthly income of KES 40,000. 

To enable her to maximize her profits from this business, she has applied for her second loan of KES 100,000 from Kadet Ltd,, which shall be used to buy poultry feeds and more chickens for rearing.

Ruth intends to use profits realized from her expanded business to educate her grandchildren and to invest in other businesses. 

She hopes that in the future, she is going to become a reknowned poultry farmer in her town and that her family will become more prosperous.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed and more chickens for rearing

loans.name: Mildred's Group

texts.en:
The members of this group are averagely married women, who average 30 years in age and with two children each. They all live in the same neighborhood in Teshie in the Republic of Ghana. They all take a loan from ID-Ghana, and have promised to repay without trouble. They sell second-hand clothing, provisions, fried fish, maize, vegetables and fruits, eggs, beads, and flour.
 
Mildred is a bead seller, and she has been doing this work for 8 years. She is standing first from right in the photo. With her loan amount of GHS 600, she intends to purchase more beads so that she can design many ornament, such as necklaces, earring, etc., and sell them to customers. She plans on making a profit of GHS 150 from this loan. This profit will enable her to repay her loan, save part with ID-Ghana, and help her husband cover day-to-day expenses. 

This is the group 's third loan with ID-Ghana, and have promise to be very loyal so that they would be able to take more loans from ID-Ghana. 
They made this promise at their orientation and training. Together, the group is taking a total amount of GHS 4,650, which would be used to purchase various items to boost their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more beads so she can design many ornaments, such as necklaces, earrings,  etc., and sell them to customers.

loans.name: Gani

texts.en:
Gani is a young man who has been working in the agriculture sector for 10 years. He works from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., Monday through Sunday. This is how he earns an income to support his family and cover his children's education. He is married with two children ages 10 and 12.

Gani is requesting a loan to pay for medical expenses and medicines so he can recover his health and continue his work routine.

loans.use: To pay personal medical expenses.

loans.name: Yasmain

texts.en:
Yasmain is a 41 year old married lady, and has run a small general store in her community for many years with the support of her husband.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 
To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for 55,000 PKR (Pakistani rupee) which she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en:
Lorpu is 35 years old and lives in the West Point area that is one of the most populated markets in Montserrado County. She is single with three children ages 3, 5, and 15. All of her children are attending school, and living at home. She did not go to school, and she described herself as a potential business woman. Lorpu manages her business well to enable her to improve her living condition. 
Over the past two years she has been running a table in the local market without facing any serious problems selling dry peppers and beans. Lorpu started this business with a little amount she got from her mother. She sells everyday spending ten hours each day on her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry peppers and beans for her business. Lorpu would like to say thanks to the supporter of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more dry peppers and beans for her business.

loans.name: Yasmain

texts.en:
Yasmain is a 33 year old married lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She has thirteen years of experience in this field. However, due to lack of availability of funds Yasmain is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR (Pakistani rupee) from Kashf Foundation. 
Yasmain intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, and packs of lace, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 38 años está casada con Jacinto de 34 años quien es padre de sus tres hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia. Cecilia se dedica a la agricultura cultivando varios de los productos que aprendió a trabajar desde muy niña tales como cacao orgánico, achiote y barbasco siguiendo así el ejemplo de sus padres quienes le inculcaron el oficio agrícola desde que fue muy niña. Todas las mañanas excepto los días de lluvia se dirige a sus terrenos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo  y algunos trabajadores de la zona para realizar las principales labores tales  como el mantenimiento de cacao cuyo trabajo como el deshierbo de maleza y abonado son indispensables para obtener una producción de calidad. Tiene la tranquilidad de desempeñar una labor muy honrada que le permite cumplir sin inconveniente con sus necesidades económicas. Al caracterizarse por ser una persona muy emprendedora espera con el tiempo reunir dinero para adquirir otro terreno e iniciarse en la producción de frutas  ya que se ve tentada en participar en las ferias dominicales de su distrito porque dejan buenas ganancias. Este es el segundo préstamo que solicita a su entidad financiera y espera de esta manera seguir trabajando de manera fluida con el apoyo necesario. En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico al por mayor y fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo esperando obtener frutos de calidad en a cosecha.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 38, is married to Jacinto, 34, who's the father of her three children.  They live together in their own house.

Cecilia makes a living as a farmer growing a variety of crops she learned to work with from a young age, such as organic cacao, annatto, and barbasco.  She follows the example of her parents, who taught her to farm when she was very young.

Cecilia goes to her land every day except when it rains.  Her husband and some local workers help her with the main tasks, such as taking care of the cacao.  Weeding and fertilizing cacao is essential for getting a quality crop.  She has the peace of mind of having a respectable job that lets her fulfill her economic needs without any problems.

Because Cecilia's a very enterprising person, she hopes, in time, to get together the money to acquire another plot of land and start growing fruit.  She wants to participate in the Sunday street fairs in her district because they produce good earnings.

This is the second loan Cecilia has requested from her financial institution and she hopes to continue working smoothly with the necessary support.  Currently she wants 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy organic soil amendments wholesale and to fertilize her crops so she can get a quality product in the harvest.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Antolin

texts.es:
Antolin agradece a los inversionitas por el apoyo brindado y desea que continuen apoyando a todos sus compañeros de la Asociacion Arariwa. 

Antolin continúa viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani y continua con la tienda de costura ósea tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio. (Huancarani, Paucartambo, Cusco) donde confecciona ropa y también hace compostura como por ejemplo subida de basta, entallado y cambio de sierre. 

En esta oportunidad Antolin requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo cierres, hilos y agujas.  

Antolin continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Antolin thanks lenders for the support provided hoping they will continue supporting all of his Asociación Arariwa companions.  He’s still living in the city of Huancarani and continues with his small tailoring shop at home located in Huancarani, Paucartambo, Cusco.  He manufactures clothing and also does repairs like adjusting hems, adjusting size and zipper replacement.  On this occasion, Antolin needs the loan to buy more work materials like zippers, thread and needles.  

He’s still a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Mamacha Rosario” communal bank that’s grateful for the opportunity provided by this means.  He also commits to make his payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials like zippers, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Carolina Jasmin

texts.es: Carolina, tiene 45 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos, reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Anteriormente tenia un salón de belleza pero ya no lo pudo sostener. lleva 4 años de haber iniciado el negocio de piñatas, elabora variedad de diseños y las vende en el mercado y por encargos. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado por 11,000 lempiras va comprar materia prima como alambre, papel de varios colores, pegamento y otros, para la elaboración de piñatas. Ella piensa en poner otra persona que le ayude para poder cumplir con los pedidos pendientes. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio para ayudar a sus hijos que estudian en la universidad y el colegio.
texts.en: Carolina, 45, is married with three children living in the town of Choloma, Cortes.  She used to own a beauty salon but was unable to keep it going.  She’s had a piñata-making business for four years now.  She makes a variety of them and sells them in the market or to order.  She’s going to use the 11,000 Lempira loan she requested to buy raw materials like wire, paper in assorted colors, glue, etc. to make piñatas.  She’s thinking about hiring someone to help her fill pending orders.  Her goal is to make the business grow to help her children who are attending university and secondary school.

loans.use: to buy piñata-making supplies.

loans.name: Gilvan

texts.en:
Gilvan, 27, came to Sorocaba from northern Brazil 3 years ago, intending to realize his dreams, one of which is to build a house. Gilvan has funded land in order to build a future home.

One of the things that he likes is football and is a supporter of Team Bahia. He works as a hairdresser in his own salon, a profession he learned from his father who was born in the city. With the money will refurbish the salon to meet more people and get more quality.

loans.use: To buy a counter, mirrors, chairs, scissors and promotional material

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria agradece a los inversionitas por el apoyo brindado y desea que continuen apoyando a todos sus compañeros de la Asociacion Arariwa.

Victoria continúa viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo y donde continua realiza todo tipo de actividad, ella sigue dedicándose a la venta de combustible y venta de artefactos como por ejemplo radios, televisores, planchas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Victoria requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería ósea gasolina y petróleo. Victoria continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Victoria thanks lenders for the support provided hoping they will continue supporting all of her Asociación Arariwa companions.  She’s still living in the city of Huancarani, Paucartambo Province and continues with her activities.  She’s still selling fuel and home appliances like radios, television sets, irons and other things.  She’s been in this business several years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into it.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy gasoline and oil.

Victoria’s still a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Mamacha Rosario” communal bank that’s grateful for the opportunity provided by this means.  She also commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and oil.

loans.name: Margara

texts.es:
Margara agradece a los inversionitas por el apoyo brindado y desea que continuen apoyando a todos sus compañeros de la Asociacion Arariwa. 

Margara continua  viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani, sigue con la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria y con la venta de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y chanchos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes y chanchos. 

Margara continua en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Su sueño es hacer crecer el negocio y tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Margara thanks lenders for the support provided hoping they will continue supporting all of her Asociación Arariwa companions.  She’s still living in the city of Huancarani and continues selling food from place to place and selling small animals like guinea pigs and pigs.  She’s been in this business several years now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy  guinea pigs and pigs.

Margara’s still a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Mamacha Rosario” communal bank that’s grateful for the opportunity provided by this means.  She also commits to make her payments as scheduled.  Her dream is to make the business grow and to own a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and pigs.

loans.name: Eddy Pablo

texts.es:
Eddy agradece a los inversionitas por el apoyo brindado y desea que continuen apoyando a todos sus compañeros de la Asociacion Arariwa.

Eddy nació en la ciudad de Colquepata pero vive en la ciudad de Huancarani, él tiene 23 años pero aun no tiene hijos. 

Eddy es un joven emprendedor y trabajador que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues su actividad económica es la elaboración de muebles de madera como por ejemplo mesas, sillas, roperos y otros más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como madera, clavos y cola. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales. 

(Las ciudades de Colquepata y Huancarani son distritos de la Provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Eddy thanks lenders for the support provided hoping they will continue supporting all of his Asociación Arariwa companions.  Eddy was born in the city of Colquepata but lives in the city of Huancarani.  He’s 23-years-old and has no children yet.

Eddy’s a young, hardworking entrepreneur who gets ahead thanks to much effort and dedication to his business which is furniture manufacturing.   He makes wood furniture like tables, chairs, armoires and others.  He’s been in this business several years now and does very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

He’s a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Mamacha Rosario” communal bank that’s grateful for the opportunity provided by this means.  On this occasion he needs the loan to buy work supplies like wood, nails and glue.  He’s grateful for and values the loan and commits to make his monthly payments.

(The cities of Colquepata and Huancarani are districts in Paucartambo Province which is in Cusco Department, Peru).

loans.use: to buy work materials such as wood, nails, and glue.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is a 54-year-old, ambitious man, living in Masindi, Uganda. He operates a transport business, but also earns a salary as a civil servant. High cost of fuel and a poor road network cause challenges to his business growth, while his desire is to diversify and venture into farming and retail businesses. 

With the proceeds from his current business, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and his desire is to see them attain degrees as minimum qualification.

Herbert intends to use the loan to pay for the servicing of his vehicle.

loans.use: to pay for servicing of his vehicle.

loans.name: Crusita Mercedes

texts.es:
Crusita, esta es una señora que tiene su negocio  en su casa de habitación, también sale a las comunidades  del poblado a vender su mercadería de lo cual tiene 8 años  de ejercer dicha actividad, es casada, su  marido trabaja como taxista  como otra actividad comercial.
Actualmente esta señora esta presento la necesidad  de expandirse  en su negocio como es  la pequeña tienda y cubrir la demanda de sus cliente, por este motivo se acerco a la oficina de  ceprodel para solicitar un crédito, que lo utilizara para compra  y venta de pantalones, camisas de hombres y mujeres, capris y camisetas.
Y de  esta manera cumplir con su sueño deseado.
texts.en:
Crusita sells clothes at home and also heads out to communities in her town to sell her merchandise.  She’s been doing this 8 years.  She’s married and her husband’s economic activity is taxi driving.

She needs to expand her small store and to cover customer demand which is why she approached the Ceprodel office to request a loan that she’ll use to buy pants, men’s and women’s shirts, Capris and t-shirts to resell thus reaching her desired dream.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yasmina Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Yasmina es una  Mujer  emprendedora, que diversifican sus actividades económicas en busca de mejores condiciones y nivel de vida, Yasmina  además de ser maestra de educación primaria de un colegio de la localidad donde vive también se dedica a la  a la crianza de cerdos, oportunidad que le brinda la características de la zona donde vive, es casada con 1 hijo a su cargo, una de las necesidades importante que tiene es la compra de cerdos para incrementar su inventario de su negocio, el crédito lo utilizara  en la compra de 8 cerdos, por eso decidió visitar las oficinas de ceprodel para ser beneficiada y poder realizar la inversión deseada y de esa manera lograr el objetivo persibido.
texts.en: Yasmina’s an enterprising woman who diversifies her activities seeking better conditions and living standard.  In addition to being an elementary school teacher in a local school, she also raises pigs which is a common activity in the area where she lives.  She’s married and has a son in her care.  One of the important needs she has is to buy pigs to increase her business inventory.  She will use the loan to buy 8 pigs and this is why she came to the Ceprodel office to be benefited and be able to make said investment thus reaching her perceived goal.

loans.use: to buy 8 pigs.

loans.name: Yamileth  Del Socorro

texts.es:
Yamileth además de ejercer la profesión de maestra de educación primaria también  se integra a la actividad de repostería como otra alternativa económica,  su núcleo familiar  es unión libre del cual tiene dos pequeños hijos.
Actualmente está presentando una necesidad de expandir su negocio como es una panadería, por tal motivo se presento a la  oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un refinanciamiento que lo utilizara para  la compra` de materia prima  como harina, manteca, manteca de cerdo, azúcar, bolsas, mermelada, huevos, margarina, levadura entre otros.
Lo que vendrá a incrementar sus ingresos y de esta manera darle mejor estabilidad y nivel económico a su hogar
texts.en:
In addition to practicing her profession as an elementary school teacher, Yamileth also bakes pastries to earn extra income.  She’s in a common law relationship and has two small children.

She currently needs to expand the bakery which is why she came by the Ceprodel office to request another loan she’ll use to buy raw materials like flour, shortening, lard, sugar, bags, marmalade, eggs, margarine and yeast, among others which will lead to higher income to give her home increased stability and higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies.

loans.name: Jamilet

texts.es:
Jamilet es una mujer emprendedora, además de ser maestra de educación primaria también ejerce otra actividad  económica como es una pequeña tienda de Ropa y Calzado que la tiene en su casa de habitación. Es casada con 2 hijos a su cargo. Actualmente tiene la necesidad de expandir su inventario de mercadería para abastecer la demanda de sus clientes, por esa  razón  visito ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y lograr el objetivo percibido, ya que el mismo lo utilizara en la compra de  ropa interior y calzado  de hombre y mujer tales como: sandalias, zapatias, bikini, brassieres, bóxer y camisas de damas.
El cual le vendría a mejorar sus ingresos familiares
texts.en: Jamilet’s an enterprising woman.  In addition to being an elementary school teacher, she also has a small clothing and shoe shop at home.  She’s married and has two children in her care.  She needs to expand her inventory of merchandise to meet customer demand which is why she visited Ceprodel to request a loan to reach her perceived objective.  She will use it to buy underwear and shoes for men and women such as sandals, slippers, bikinis, bras, boxer shorts and women’s shirts which will lead to higher family income.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Sandra Antonia

texts.es:
Sandra ,es una señora casada, con un hijo a su cargo al que le brida todo su apoyo para su desarrollo. Actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria con 12 años de experiencia.
Esta señora se vio en la necesidad de acercarse nuevamente  a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un refinanciamiento para el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que se encuentra en mal estado, y este lo utilizara para compra de materiales de construcción tales como: cemento arena, perlines y zinc. Y de esta manera tener mejores condiciones de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Sandra’s married and has a son in her care who she provides with everything needed for his development.  She’s currently working as an elementary school teacher and has 12 years’ experience.

She needed once again to approach the Ceprodel office to request a new home-improvement loan because her house is in bad shape.  She will use it to buy building supplies like sand, roofing purlins and metal sheets to improve living conditions at home.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
La señora Marlene, se dedica arduamente a la labor como maestra de Primaria, desde hace 7 años, es Casada con 2 hijos a los que está apoyando  para su formación, Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Marlene atraviesa, es de mejorar sus condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Ladrillo, Perlin, Hierro, Cemento y zinc, por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
Es importante destacar la importancia de la misma, y le agradece a ceprodel por el apoyo del financiamiento oportuno para resolver su necesidad.
texts.en: Marlene has worked hard as an elementary school teacher for 7 years.  She’s married and supports the development of her two children.  One of Marlene’s current needs is to improve the conditions of her house which is in poor shape.  Because of this she’s decided to call on Ceprodel to request a loan to buy building supplies like bricks, purlins, iron rods, cement and metal sheeting to improve her children’s living  conditions.  It’s important to point out how important this is.  She thanks Ceprodel for the support from the timely loan to meet this need.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es: La señora María es una más,  de las beneficiadas  con dicho crédito el cual le permite efectuar la actividad planteada, por eso visito las oficinas de ceprodel para plantear su necesidad, ya que dicho crédito sería utilizado en la compra de 75 sillas plásticas para alquiler, Actividad Anexa   a su profesión como es la de Maestra de Educación Primaria, dicha actividad comercial  la ejerce con el objetivo de mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, ella es soltera, la señora María  le agradece a ceprodel   por el apoyo que tanto lo necesitaba y la oportunidad misma de poder realizar lo que tanto deseaba como es de incrementar su inventario y poder  lograr lo deseado.
texts.en: María is another person benefited by the loan that will allow her to carry out her planned activity.  She visited the Ceprodel office to state her need.  The loan will be used to buy 75 plastic chairs to lease.  This is an activity additional to her profession which is elementary school teacher.  She does the commercial activity aiming at improving her conditions and standard of living.  She’s single.  María thanks Ceprodel for this support she so needed and for the opportunity of being able to do what she so desired which was  to increase her inventory to reach her dream.

loans.use: to buy 75 plastic chairs.

loans.name: Zoila Balvina

texts.es:
La Señora Zoila se encuentra realizando un re préstamo a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito San Vicente. Vive por un sector de la Victoria Portete en Cuenca, este sector tiene un clima frió y cuenta con hermoso paisajes, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, su principal fuente de ingresos es la agricultura, crianza de animales y el comercio que lo realizan en la ciudad.
Doña Zoila tiene 43 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 22, 19, 17 y 15 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, sus dos siguientes hijos estudian en un colegio de la localidad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de propia.
La Sra. Zoila se dedica a las tareas del campo, como es la crianza de animales y la agricultura, actividades que aprendió desde muy niña, también trabaja en el bordado este trabajo lo aprendió trabajando y por habilidad, ahora todas estas actividades le dan la oportunidad de mejorar la estabilidad de su economía y salir adelante con toda su familia, también le ha dado la oportunidad de ser una persona independiente económicamente. Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de cerdos e hilos, su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de ganado y telas. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la unión, solidaridad que existe así mismo que los créditos le han permitido crecer en su negocio. Su meta es tener un vehículo propio.
texts.en:
Zoila is requesting another loan with her friends and fellow San Vicente communal bank members.  She lives in Cuenca’s Victoria Portete zone which has a cold climate and beautiful scenery.  Its residents are kind, gracious and still retain their culture and traditions.  The main sources of income are agriculture, animal husbandry and commerce that’s carried out in the city.

Zoila, 43, is married and has four children who are 22, 19, 17 and 15 years of age.  Her oldest two children work and help her out economically.  The next two attend the local secondary school.  Her husband works in construction and the house they live in is their property.

Zoila works doing field work like raising animals and agriculture, activities she learned as a little girl.  She also embroiders having learned this by working at it and because she’s skilled at it.  Now, all these activities provide her with the opportunity to improve her economic stability and to get ahead with her entire family.  It’s also allowed her to be independent economically.

She used her previous loan to buy pigs and thread and will use the new loan to buy cattle and fabric.  She likes her communal bank because of the unity and solidarity that exists among them as well as the loans that have allowed her business to grow.  Her goal is to have a vehicle of her own.

loans.use: to buy cattle and fabric.

loans.name: Mashiel De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La joven Mashiel de los Ángeles, es supervisora de personal de una de las zonas francas de la ciudad de León, desde hace nueve años. Sale de su casa a las 5:30am e inicia sus labores desde 06:00 am finalizándolas a las 2:00 pm este horario de lunes a sábado, es madre soltera de un hijo. Realiza estas labores para el sustento de su familia. 

La joven Mashiel, el crédito que solicito a Ceprodel fue utilizado para gastos escolares de su hijo permitiéndole mejor la educación y así solventar todos los gastos del mismo.
texts.en:
Young Mashiel de los Ángeles has been a human resources manager in one of the free trade zones of the town of León for the past nine years. She leaves her house at 5:30 a.m., starts working at 6 a.m. and she's done by 2 p.m. She keeps these hours from Monday to Saturday. She's a single mother of a son. She does this work in order to support her family.

The loan that Mashiel requested from Ceprodel was used to pay for her son's school costs, allowing her to improve his education and afford all of his expenses.

loans.use: to pay for school costs.

loans.name: María Elvia

texts.es:
La Señora. María forma parte del grupo de crédito San Vicente desde hace algún tiempo, vive por un sector de la Victoria Portete en Cuenca, este sector tiene un clima frió y cuenta con hermoso paisajes, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, su principal fuente de ingresos es la agricultura, crianza de animales y el comercio que lo realizan en la ciudad.
Doña María tiene 32 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 16, 14, 13 y 12 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su última hija estudia en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de propia.
La Señora María desde que tenía una muy corta edad se dedica a laborar en la crianza de animales y a la agricultura que sus padres le enseñaron todas las técnicas para una buena cosecha, ahora estas actividades le han brindado la oportunidad de pasar en casa al cuidado de sus seres queridos así como tener su propia independencia económica. Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de cuye, gallinas y en alimento para animales, su nuevo crédito va hacer invertido en la compra de abono para mejorar sus potreros. Las reuniones con sus amigas es lo que más le gusta ya que comparte muy buenos momentos con cada una de ellas.
texts.en:
María has been part of the San Vicente credit group for some time.  She lives in Cuenca’s Victoria Portete zone, a sector with a cold climate and beautiful scenery.  Its people are kind and gracious and still retain their culture and traditions.  The main sources of income are agriculture, animal husbandry and commerce that takes place in the city.

María, 32, is married and has four children aged 16, 14, 13 and 12.  Her oldest three children attend secondary school and her youngest daughter attends the local elementary school.  Her husband works in construction and the house they live in is their property.

Since a very young age, María has been raising animals and working in agriculture.  Her parents taught her all the techniques needed to get a good harvest.  These activities have given her the opportunity to stay home to care for her loved ones while at the same time giving her economic independence.

She used her previous loan to buy guinea pigs, chickens and animal feed.  She will use her new loan to buy manure to improve her pasture.  What she likes best are the meetings with her fellow members because she shares very good times with each one of them.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es:
Milagro de 27 años, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada; el esposo se dedica a trabajar como vigilante a 37 kilómetros de su casa, tiene que realizar turnos de 36 horas. Esto le genera tener poco tiempo para su familia. 

Milagro tiene que pasar en su casa realizando los oficios del hogar y verificando los cultivos de granos básicos,  que junto a su esposo han cultivado, también tiene que cuidar a su hijo el cual esta en parvulario y de una sobrina que esta en sexto grado.

Ella se dedica a realizar los oficios del hogar, pero también trabaja la agricultura ya que su papá le enseño este rubro desde su niñez, por eso ella no pudo terminar sus estudios y cuando murió su madre a ella le toco desempeñar todos los trabajos de su casa.

Con el crédito el comprara bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, para la construcción de una habitación, ya que siente que su casa le falta un poco más de espacio y también quiere independizare de su papá, debido a que habita en la misma casa que él, así ella podrá dedicarse de lleno a cuidar a su hijo y el bebe que está por nacer.
Ella desea en su futuro, tener su casita terminada, donde pueda cuidar a sus hijos, que ellas crezcan y sean personas de bien en la comunidad, trabajadores y responsables. Ella desea darles todo el estudio que no pudo tener, para que sean profesionales y tengan buenos trabajos con los cuales ellos se puedan desempeñar en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Milagro is 27 years old. She went to school up to the ninth grade. She is married and her husband works as a security guard 37 kilometers from their house. He works 36 hour shifts. 

Milagro has to go through her house doing the housework and checking on the basic grains crops that she has planted with her husband. She also has to care for her son, who is in pre-school, and a niece who is in sixth grade.  

She does the housework but she also farms, since her father taught this to her since she was a child. When her mother died she had to do the housework.

With the loan, she will buy blocks, sand, cement, and iron to build a room. She thinks that her house needs a little more space, and she also wants to become independent from her father, because she lives in the same house as him. This way, she can spend all of her time caring for her son and the baby who is about to be born. In the future, she wants to finish her house where she can care for her children and for them to grow and be upright people in the community  who are hardworking and responsible. She wants to provide them with the education that she couldn't have so that they can have good jobs and work well in the community.

loans.use: to buy blacks, sand, cement, and iron to build a room.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina de 41 años, estudio hasta segundo grado, es casada;  el esposo trabaja en una agencia de correos,  tienen seis  hijos ellos viven en la casa con ellos; pero tres  de ellos trabajan y tres estudian en la escuela del municipio, los tres que trabajan casi todo el tiempo pasan fuera.

Reina elabora refrigerios a una institución, desde hace un año.  Pero también elabora pasteles en la casa y esto lo vende desde hace dos años.  Ella pasa sola con sus tres hijos, ya que los demás miembros de la familia llegan hasta las horas de la noche y ella busca la forma de no pasar aburrida. También, ve que le genera ingresos y los hace;  antes ella se dedicaba a la corta de café en la época de los cultivos, pero luego vio que eso solo era por épocas y fue cuando decidió poner su negocio de pasteles y yuca fritas en este negocio le ayuda la hermana y las hijas cuando vienen de la escuela.

El préstamo que está solicitando a fundación Campo, es para comprar 5 bolsas de cemento y 5 pliegos de lámina para construir una champita a un servicio sanitario, que ya no le funciona ya que es de mucha utilidad y de higiene para la familia.

El sueño de Reina, es terminar ese servicio y que su familia, ya no esté en peligro de contraer una enfermedad y de contaminar el medio ambiente; pero también con lo poco que le sobre comprara más material, para hacer los refrigerios y vender los pasteles para ir poco a poco incrementando el negocio y las ganancias para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Reina, 41, completed second grade.  She’s married and her husband works for a post office.  They have six children living at home with them; three of them work and three attend the local school.  The three that work spend most of their time away.

Reina has been providing snacks at an institution for a year.  She’s also baked cakes at home to sell for the last two years.  She spends her time alone with her three children because the rest of the family members come home late at night and she looks for ways not to be bored.  She also sees the income she earns so she bakes them.  She used to work picking coffee during harvest season but noting that this was just seasonal work she decided to start her cake and fried cassava business.  Her sister helps her and so do her daughters when they come home from school.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy five sacks of cement and five metal sheets to build a shed over around a toilet because it’s not working now and it’s very useful and sanitary for the family.

Reina’s dream is to finish building the toilet so that her family will be safe from contracting diseases and contaminating the environment.  Also, with the little left over she will buy ingredients needed to make the snacks and to sell the cakes to gradually increase business and profits to move her family forward.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet and his family live in Ijevan in the Tavush region. Hamlet is married and has two sons who are school-aged. For 26 years, Hamlet has engaged in the repair and sale of watches. He rents a small place for his work where he simultaneously exhibits and sells watches. His workshop is very well-known in his city. His shop is highly visited by students and pupils as well, especially in the months of September and October. 

Hamlet has an unbelievably rich credit history: 12 loans perfectly paid back to Nor Horizon. This will be the fourth deal with Kiva lenders. Hamlet asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to buy different types of watches for sale, as well as some equipment for his repair work.

loans.use: to buy different types of watches for sale and some equipment for his repair work

loans.name: Rolando Eleuterio

texts.es:
El señor Rolando Eleuterio, es comerciante de venta de ropa desde hace 20 años en unos de los Mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de león, inicia sus labores a las 6:00 am preparando y arreglando sus productos que ofertará  a  su clientela finalizándola a las 5:00 pm, negocio con  el cual logra brindar el sustento diario a su familia, anteriormente laboraba como zapatero. 

El señor Rolando solicito el crédito a Ceprodel  el cual fue  utilizado para la compra de productos como pantalones, camisetas, camisas, blusas, licras, ropa interior para ambos sexos, que servirá para mejorar los ingresos y su inventario con productos nuevos dándole un mejor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Rolando Eleuterio a merchant who has sold clothes for 20 years in one of the most popular markets in the city of León. He starts work at 6:00 a.m. preparing and arranging the products that he will offer to his customers, ending at 5:00 p.m. With this business, he is able to support his family every day. Previously, he worked as a shoemaker. 

Rolando asked Ceprodel for a loan which was used to buy products such as pants, t-shirts, shirts, blouses, spandex shorts, and underwear for both sexes. This will serve to improve his income and his inventory of new products, bringing more well being to his family.

loans.use: to buy pants, shorts, blouses, spandex shorts, and underwear for both sexes.

loans.name: Yasmin Esperanza

texts.es:
La  señora Yasmin Esperanza,  es madre soltera de  2 hijos que se encuentran a su cargo, es vendedora de bisuterías ambulante en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de león, desde hace 19 años,  ofertando  sus productos  desde las 6:00 am y finaliza hasta las 5:00 pm a las diferentes personas que viajan a diferentes zonas del país.

La señora Yasmin realiza esta labor para la mantención de sus hijos.

Este crédito fue utilizado para compra ropa usada, cosméticos, entre otros artículos. 

La señora Yasmin con los créditos que Ceprodel le ha bridado ha logrado a comprar productos de  mayor calidad para ofertarles a sus clientes y público en general, y con esta ganancia ha logrado hacer mejora a su vivienda, ha incrementado su capital de trabajo y sueña  que su negocio siga creciendo cada día más.
texts.en:
Yasmin Esperanza is a single mother of two children still in her care.  She has sold costume jewelry from place to place in one of León’s markets for 19 years.  She sells from 6am until 5pm to people who travel to various parts of the country.  She does this work to support her children.  The loan was used to buy used clothes and cosmetics, among other goods.

Ceprodel loans have made it possible for Yasmin to buy higher quality products to sell to her customers and to the general public.  With profits she’s made home improvements. Her capital has increased and she dreams with the business continuing to grow more every day.

loans.use: to buy used clothes, cosmetics and popular goods.

loans.name: Alejandrina Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina Mercedes es una persona muy esforzada ya que con mucho sacrificio logro finalizar sus estudios ingresando a trabajar al ministerio de salud de león desde hace 10 años dándole a su familia la estabilidad económica para salir adelante.

 La señora Alejandrina Mercedes  empieza sus labores a las 7:30 am finalizando a las 4:00 pm de lunes a viernes.

El crédito que solicitó la señora Alejandrina Mercedes a Ceprodel  será utilizado para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cemento, arena, hierro dándole un mejor bienestar a ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandrina Mercedes is a very determined woman who with much sacrifice was able to complete her studies.  She’s been working for the León Ministry of Health for ten hears providing economic stability for her family’s progress.  She starts work at 7:30am and ends at 4pm, Monday to Friday.

The loan Alejandrina Mercedes asked from Ceprodel will be used to buy building supplies like cement, sand and iron rods to provide better well-being for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Uchi

texts.en:
Uchi is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees for her kids.

Uchi operates a grocery/vegetable sales stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, onions and two crates of tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, onions and two crates of tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Domingo Leonel

texts.es:
El señor Domingo Leonel, es comerciantes de frutas y verduras ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de león, inicia sus labores desde la 4:00 am ofertando al por mayor a otros comerciantes al mismo tiempo vende al detalle su producto, finalizando sus labores a las 3:00 pm, el señor domingo realiza esta labor para obtener el sustento a su familia 

Este crédito fue utilizado para compra de plátanos al por mayor.

El señor Domingo Leonel, se encuentra agradecido porque los créditos que le ha brindado Ceprodel, los mismos le han ayudado a incrementar su capital de trabajo ya que compra a un menor costo sus productos de contado  y no de crédito y así ha  mejorado sus condiciones y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Domingo Leonel is a fruit and vegetable vendor located in one of León’s markets.  He starts work at 4am selling to other merchants at wholesale and he also sells retail; he ends his workday at 3pm.  Domingo does this work to earn his family’s support.  This loan was used to buy bananas at wholesale.

Domingo Leonel is grateful for the loans Ceprodel has awarded him that have helped him increase his working capital because he’s able to pay cash for his products and not on credit which has improved his conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Brenda Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Brenda Cecilia es una persona muy esforzada ya que con mucho sacrificio logro finalizar sus estudios ingresando a trabajar al ministerio de salud de león desde hace 27 años dándole a su familia la estabilidad económica para salir adelante.

 La señora Brenda Cecilia  empieza sus labores a las 7:30 am finalizando a las 6:00 pm de lunes a viernes y sábados de 8:00 am a 12:00 Md.

El crédito que solicito la señora Brenda Cecilia  a Ceprodel  será utilizado para la compra de productos de belleza como perfumenes, colonias, joyas, etc. negocio que complementa con su salario para darle un mejor bienestar a ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Brenda Cecilia’s a very determined woman who with much effort was able to complete her schooling.  She’s worked for the León Ministry of Health for 27 years providing economic stability for her family’s progress.  She starts work at 7:30am and ends at 6pm, Monday to Friday and from 8am to noon on Saturday.

The loan she requested from Ceprodel will be used to buy beauty products like perfume, cologne, costume jewelry, etc. for the business she has to complement her salary and provide better well-being for her and for her family.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Germán Antonio

texts.es: Germán  es un señor que le gusta relacionarse con niños , ya que su vocación es maestro de educación primaria, el cual la ejerce en un colegio de la comunidad .,es casado , con dos hijos  a quienes les brinda todo el apoyo necesario para su formación. Este señor  tiene una urgencia de mejorar su vivienda debido a esta necesidad visito a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento el que utilizaría en la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, cerámica y mano de obra. El cual le vendría mejorar sus condiciones de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
German is a man who enjoys relating to children since his vocation is being an elementary school teacher; he works in a local school.  He’s married with two children who he provides with everything necessary for their development.

He urgently needs to do some home improvements which is why he visited Ceprodel to request financing to buy building materials like cement, sand and tile and to pay labor costs.  This will improve his living conditions at home.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Xiomara Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Xiomara Petrona es una persona muy esforzada ya que con mucho sacrificio logro sacar a su familia dándole a sus dos hijos estudios y mejor nivel de vida.

 La señora Xiomara Petrona  empieza sus labores a las 7:30 am finalizando a las 6:00 pm de lunes a viernes y sábados de 8:00 am a 12:00 Md.

El crédito que solicito la señora Xiomara Petrona  a Ceprodel  fue utilizado para la compra de productos de construcción tales como arena, cemento, hierro y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de una pila séptica ya que actualmente presenta problemas de aguas residuales y necesita mejorar sus condiciones, para darle   un mejor bienestar a ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Xiomara Petrona is a very hardworking woman who with much sacrifice has been able to get her family ahead, giving her two children an education and a better quality of life.  

Xiomara Petrona starts work around 7:30 a.m., finishing around 6:00 p.m. Monday through Friday, and 8:00 a.m. to 12 noon on Saturday.  

The loan that Xiomara Petrona asked Ceprodel for was used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, and iron, as well as to pay for labor costs to build a septic tank. Right now she has waste water problems and she needs to improve her living conditions to provide more well being for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, iron, and more.

loans.name: Emilio Baltazar

texts.es:
Emilio de 31 años,  estudio bachillerato,  es casado; la esposa trabaja en lo domestico por el momento  no han procreado hijos. Él  vive con la esposa y la mamá.

Emilio tiene 9 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de tustacas y totoposte en el municipio. Este negocio lo aprendió de un amigo que tiene este negocio y lo inculco a que le ayudara fue así como aprendió.  Emilio también maneja un microbús llevando unos niños a la escuela, es así que el trabajo de las tustacas y totopostes lo hace de las 9am a las 11am y de 2pm a 5 pm ; ya que de 6 am a 8 am lleva los niños a la escuela y los pasa a llevar de regreso de 12 m a 1 pm.

Emilio con el préstamo solicitado a la Fundación Campo, comprara una computadora portátil, esta computadora que comprara es para darle un buen uso al internet y estar informado de los acontecimientos que en el mundo están pasando. Una de las necesidades que serán satisfechas, es que mediante esta máquina y el internet aparte de actualizarse, también  buscara a más clientes.  

Unos de sus sueños en el negocio de tustacas, es exportarla a otros países y vía internet buscar los clientes de otros países y tener más clientes y así poner en alto el país, que se exportan los ricos totopostes .
texts.en:
Emilio is 31 years old and completed high school. He's married; his wife does domestic chores and they currently don't have children. He lives with his wife and his mother.

Emilio has been making tustacas (baked corn and cheese dough) and totopostes (baked corn tortilla) in his town for the past nine years. He learned this trade from a friend who owns this type of business and insisted that he help him, and then he learned it. Emilio also drives a few children to school on a minibus. He works on his tustacas and totopostes business from 9 a.m. to 11 a.m. and from 2 p.m. to 5 p.m. In addition, he drives the children to school from 6 a.m. to 8 a.m. and picks them up and takes them home from noon to 1 p.m.

With the loan he requested from Fundación Campo, Emilio will purchase a laptop computer so he can make good use of the internet and keep himself informed about the events going on around the world. One of the needs that will be fulfilled is that by using this computer and the internet, aside from being up-to-date he'll also seek more customers.

One of his dreams regarding his tustacas business is to export to other countries, seek customers from other countries through the internet and get a larger clientele. Therefore he'll give his country a good name by exporting the delicious totopostes.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop computer.

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
Rasul is a 23-year-old married man and a father of two children. He has been working in the agriculture sector for three years. Rasul is a hard worker. He specializes in growing palm trees and selling dates.

Rasul takes good care of his production and makes sure that every tree has the care it needs to ensure a high quality product.

Rasul will use this loan to purchase fertilizers, mainly organic, and to renovate his farm, including installing a drip irrigation system to control weed growth and in turn reduce the use of chemicals.

The story of Rasul and his farm is just one of the many examples of the businesses Izdiharona for Economic Development supports.

loans.use: A loan for $2,500 helped Rasul to buy fertilizers and renovate his farm.

loans.name: Kawther's Group

texts.en:
Kawther is a 28-year-old Iraqi. She is married and the mother of one child. 

With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Kawther is one of the many Iraqi women who work from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Kawther has 10 years' experience with using her skills to make dresses for women and children based on orders.  Occasionally she also works on other small fabric items for the household, such as pillow cases and decorative rugs.

She would like to buy a new sewing machine and a small generator, both of which would allow her to work better, faster, and in a more organized fashion. Being able to work exactly when she would like to -- and not just when the government provides power -- will greatly improve her work conditions. To be able to afford the purchases, she is taking a small loan from Relief International Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and a small generator

loans.name: Limuna

texts.en:
Limuna is a lovely woman with a pure soul. She is 52 years old. She is the mother of son aged 25 & daughter aged 22. 

Limuna's engagement in animal husbandry is the main source of income for her family. She has been breeding cattle for more than 25 years. She is helped by her husband and son. 

Now she has dairy cows, and she wants to to buy small-horned livestock to increase her herd of cattle in the future. First, though, she has to purchase the needs for her son's betrothal. For this purpose Limuna has applied for a loan of AZN 1,600.

loans.use: To purchase the needs for her son's betrothal.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a 29 years old and from Nyahururu. She is married to Peter, who is a businessman, and they do not have any children yet.

Serah runs a beauty salon that she has operated for the past three years. Serah would like to buy more stocks of artificial hair additions, hair chemicals and oils to be sold to her customers.   For this reason she has applied for her first loan of KES 30,000 from Kadet Ltd.

Her monthly income right now is KES 15,000.  She intends to use the expected profits from her expanded business to open a barber shop.

Her hopes for her future business are that she will open a hair and beauty college.

loans.use: To buy stocks of artificial hair additions, hair chemicals, and oils for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Juana Bertilda

texts.es: La Señora Bertilda, es una mujer que se desempeña como conserje en un colegio de la localidad donde vive, es soltera , actualmente está solicitando  un financiamiento a ceprodel que utilizara para completar  el pago de un lote de terreno colindante a su casa de habitación, al mismo tiempo realizar el trámite de escritura  y de esa manera crear mejores  condiciones al ceno familiar, el que agradece por lo oportuno del credito y a los inversionistas por el apoyo  a estos sectores tan necesitados que de no ser así no se abrieran nuevos caminos en la vida.
texts.en:
Bertilda works as a custodian at a school in the area where she lives.  She is single.  She is currently requesting a loan from Ceprodel to complete payment on a plot of land adjoining her house.  She will also complete the deed application.  This way she will create better conditions for her family.

She is grateful for the loan opportunity and thanks the lenders for supporting these needy sectors that, without such help, would not be able to follow new paths in life.

loans.use: to pay for a plot of land and the deed application.

loans.name: Ashia

texts.en:
Asha operates an open air food stall business; her potential customers are market dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality of products in the market. The previous loan helped her to buy food ingredients for her food business.

Here again she comes to you requesting for a loan of Kshs 20,000.  She wants to purchase sacks of beans, cooking fat, wheat flour, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, cooking fat, wheat flour, and rice.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 53 years old and is from Nyahururu. She is married to her husband, John, and they are blessed with three children, ages 11, 15, and 18. 

She is a shopkeeper. She has been operating this business for the last 15 years. Pauline is applying for her third loan of Kshs 40,000 from Kadet Ltd. The loan will enable her to increase her stock of rice, sugar, cooking fat, flour, soap, and soft drinks to sell to her customers. 

Her monthly business income is currently Kshs 30,000. She hopes to use the profit from her expanded business to educate her children and start another business. Her hope and dream for the future is to transition to a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice, cooking fat, salt, flour, soap, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Korto

texts.en:
Please meet a local businesswoman, Korto, from Liberia, who is attending a university. She mentioned how her business has been a complete support for her studies. Korto lives and works in New-Kru-Town, Liberia which is one of the poorer areas in terms of living conditions. She is 34 years old, and married. 

For the past ten years now, Korto has been a seller of ladies' handbags in the local market. She started this business with a small amount of money which she earned from her mother. She says she enjoys the buying from her customers and the money she generates from her business. 

Korto is requesting a loan to purchase more ladies' handbags for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies' handbags for her business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
25-year-old Patricia is married to a local businessman. They have a 5-year-old child who is currently attending school and living at home. Patricia unfortunately had to leave school in the eighth grade, but she started a business selling charcoal by bag in the local market. 

With the loan proceeds, she will buy enough charcoal to increase her sales. Her problem is the small amount of goods in her shop. She got money from her husband to establish this business six years ago, and she learned by seeing other businesswomen. She enjoys the flows of custumers. Her plan is to move from the charcoal business to the general shop business.

loans.use: to buy enough charcoal to increase her sales

loans.name: Sol Naciente  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Sol Naciente está formado por 7 mujeres quienes viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que goza de un clima frió, de una arquitectura única y por ello es considerada como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999. Su gente es amable, gentil aun mantienen su cultura y tradiciones como su gastronomía que es muy variada y cautiva el paladar de todos sus visitantes.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Mónica, se encuentra realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Sol Naciente, le gusta esta forma de créditos por que le dan la oportunidad de crecer en sus negocios.
La Señora Mónica es una madre soltera, tiene 26 años de edad y ha concebido una niña  de 4 meses de edad, vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.
Doña Mónica trabaja a diario en los quehaceres de su hogar, pero para solventar sus gastos y los de su pequeña hija se dedica al trabajo que aprendió de sus padres el cual es la compra y venta de animales, lleva 4 años en el negocio y trabaja de domingo a domingo. Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de ganado para incrementar su negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Sol Naciente (Rising Sun) credit group consists of 7 women who live in the city of Cuenca, a city that has a cold climate and unique architecture and, therefore, has been considered a World Heritage Site since 1999. The people are kind and gentile and still maintain their culture and traditions. The gastronomy is varied and captivates the palate of all visitors. 
One member of this group is Mónica who is getting her second loan alongside her friends and co-workers in the credit group Sol Naciente. She likes this form of credit because it gives them the opportunity to grow their businesses. 
Mónica is a 26-year-old single mother who has a four-month-old daughter. She lives in a house with her parents with whom she shares the costs of household expenses.
Doña Monica works daily on chores in the home but to support herself and her little daughter she is engaged in work she has learned from her parents which is the buying and selling of animals. She has had this business for 4 years working from Sunday to Sunday. She will invest her loan in the purchase of cattle to increase her business. Her goal is to own her own home.
The small photo is from a partner who could not be present when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman and has four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that lacks electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanatumu operates a grocery stall at the market and sells vegetables to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of high transportation costs. The Kshs 40,000 loan will be used to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Elida Ermelinda

texts.es: Elida de 57 años de edad habita junto a su familia en casa propia desde hace 30 años. Ella es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y responsable. Ella se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo y de res en el mercado central del municipio.  Su casa es muy humilde pero propia que poco a poco va mejorando.  Actualmente el techo del corredor de su casa se encuentra dañado y el agua se filtra cuando llueve.  Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para hacer el cambio del techo.  Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así poder mejorar sus condiciones.
texts.en:
Elida is 57 years old. She has lived with her family in their own house for the past 30 years. She is a hard-working, enterprising and responsible woman. She sells beef and pork in the municipality's central market.

Her house is very modest but clean and little by little she is improving it. At present the roof of the corridor is damaged and water filters in when it rains. To repair this Elida is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest it in buying galvanized sheeting, wood and nails to replace the roof. She hopes to be able to count on this support and be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, wood and nails to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David de 30 años,  estudio hasta octavo grado, está acompañado; su  compañera de vida,  se dedica a realizar  oficios domésticos  como empleada en otros hogares, ellos tienen 2 hijas que viven en casa  una de ellas la de 7 años estudia la preparatoria.

Don David presta sus servicios trabajando como empleado de seguridad, él se dedica a esta actividad de seguridad desde hace 5 años como él ya había prestado su servicio militar, se le hizo fácil trabajar de seguridad, aparte de ser empleado de seguridad, se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos. Antes de ser empleado de seguridad, siempre se dedicaba a la agricultura. La distancia que existe del trabajo a su casa, está retirado él viaja 2 horas en bus para llegar a su lugar de trabajo.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para implementar una pequeña granja de engorde de pollos, ya que el ha visto en la  actividad una alternativa que le generara  ingresos y salir adelante económicamente. Él específicamente comprara 100 pollitos, 2 sacos de alimento concentrado, crecimiento y dos sacos de alimento para engorde. El préstamo le ayudara para obtener mayores ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida con su familia. La idea de la granja era un proyecto que tenía en mente hace mucho tiempo,  pero por falta de recursos no había podido poner en marcha el pequeño proyecto de la granja de pollos.

En un futuro don David piensa tener una granja más grande, una mayor  producción  y ser una familia productores en grande de pollos de engorde. Para sus hijas espera que sean personas de bien, que logren sacar sus estudios superiores, las ganancias las utilizara para invertir más en el negocio comprando más  pollos  ampliando más el local.
texts.en:
David, who is 30-years old, went to school until eighth grade.  He lives with his partner, who makes her living as a domestic servant in other homes.  They have two daughters who live at home.  Their 7-year old daughter goes to school.   

Don David works as a security guard.  He has been in this line of work for five years.  Since he had completed his military service, it was easy for him to get a job in security.  In addition to his security work, don David makes his living in agriculture planting basic grains.  Before becoming a security guard, he always worked in agriculture.  Don David travels far from work to home; it takes two hours by bus for him to get home from work. 

The loan that don David is requesting is for setting up a small broiler chicken farm.  He sees this as an alternative business that will generate income for him and allow him to get ahead financially.  Specifically, he will purchase 100 chicks, two sacks of growth animal feed and two sacks of fattening animal feed.  The loan will help him to earn a greater income and to have a better quality of life, along with his family.  The idea of the farm is something don David has had in mind for a long time.  However, because of a lack of resources, he hasn't been able to put his small chicken farm project into action. 

In the future, don David plans to have a bigger farm, greater production and to be a large-scale family producer of broiler hens.  He hopes that his daughters become respectable people who are able to complete advanced studies in school.  Don David will use his earnings to invest further in his business by purchasing more chickens and expanding his sales area.

loans.use: to purchase 100 chicks, 2 sacks of growth animal feed and 2 sacks of fattening animal feed.

loans.name: María Martha

texts.es:
La Señora María es una socia fundaora del grupo de crédito San Vicente, todo este tiempo los créditos le han beneficiado para ampliar sus negocios y unir más los lasos de amistad con todas sus compañeras de la comunidad. Vive por un sector de la Victoria Portete en Cuenca, este sector tiene un clima frió y cuenta con hermoso paisajes, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, su principal fuente de ingresos es la agricultura, crianza de animales y el comercio que lo realizan en la ciudad.
La Señora María vive en unión libre y fruto de su unión  ha concebido 2 hijos, su primera hija tiene 11 años de edad y está estudiando en una escuelita de la comunidad, su segundo hijo es de un mes de nacido, su esposo labora como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de familiares.
Doña María se dedica a tareas del campo como es la crianza de animales como cuyes, pollos y ganado, la agricultura es para el consumo de su hogar y su negocio más fuerte es el bordado actividad que la aprendió por habilidad y trabajando. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes, alimento para animales y telas. Su meta es continuar prosperando y tener un negocio como una tienda.
texts.en:
Maria is a founding member of the San Vicente Credit Group.  All this time the loans have helped her to expand her economic activities and strengthen the ties of friendship between her and the other women in the community.  Maria lives in a sector of Victoria Portete in Cuenca.  This sector has a cool climate  and beautiful countryside.  The people are friendly and kind, and still maintain their culture and traditions.  Their main source of income is agriculture, raising animals and doing business in the city.  

Maria lives with her common law husband, with whom she has two children.  Their first child is an 11-year-old daughter who attends a small school in the community, and their second is a son who is just a month old.  Her husband works in construction.  They don't own a house so they live with family.  Maria works doing rural activities such as raising animals like guinea pigs, chickens, and cattle.  The agriculture is for home consumption.  Her strongest business is embroidery, which she learned through natural ability and practice.  She will use the money from the loan to buy chickens, guinea pigs, animal feed, and fabric.  Her goal is to continue to prosper and to have a business such as a shop.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, animal feed, and fabric

loans.name: Douglas Mauricio

texts.es:
Douglas es un hombre ejemplar con una visión sobre los negocios, ya que actualmente cuenta con tres actividades comerciales habiendo iniciado con una librería de las cual se han derivado las demás actividades las que  con buen resultado  lo que manifiesta la satisfacción absoluta por el éxito de los mismos, el cual tiene 18 años  de experiencia en dichas labores. Es casado, con un hijo a quien le brinda todo su apoyo para su formación. 
Actualmente está  atravesando una necesidad de expandir su negocio y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes , por tal motivo se acerco a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un refinanciamiento el cual lo utilizara  para Compra y venta de pacas de ropa de segunda, pacas de pantalón de hombres, pacas de blusas de mujer, camisetas  y zapatos de hombres y ropa de niños.
texts.en: Douglas is an exemplary man with a good eye for business.  He currently engages in three different commercial activities, having started with a bookstore from which he has diversified with good results.  He feels fully satisfied with the success of these endeavors, and he now has 18 years of experience with his businesses.  He is married and has a child, for whose education he provides all the support he can.  Currently Douglas needs to expand his business to meet the demand from his customers, and for this reason he approached CEPRODEL to request a loan.  He will use it to buy and sell bulk shipments of secondhand clothing, bulk shipments of men's pants, bulk shipments of women's tops, men's t-shirts and shoes, and children's clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Muhammed's Group

texts.en:
Muhammed is a hard working Iraqi man. He is 34 years old, married and a father of 3 children.

He has 10 years experience selling fruits and vegetables, a business he would like to improve by purchasing his own 3-wheeled motorcycle wagon, which will allow him to pick up and transport his goods without involving others who usually charge a high price for the work. Cutting out the 'middle man' will allow Muhammed to choose and purchase the fresh goods directly from the growers and will give him a better opportunity to sell and improve his income from the business. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase a 3 wheeled motorcycle wagon

loans.name: Nataiyuang

texts.en:
Nataiyuag is 31 years old, married to Rareu and supports a family of eight members. Her children are aged between six and 22 years. She is a mixed farmer and she has run her business for the last ten years. Her monthly income is KES 10000.

Nataiyuag is currently servicing her fourth loan from KADET of KES 80000 that will facilitate her to prepare the land and buy planting seedlings. She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. Her future dream is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and prepare land for cultivation.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 29-year-old lady from Nyahururu. She is married to a business man known as James and together they are blessed with two children aged 10 and 6 years old.

She owns a mini boutique where she sells ladies jewellery like earrings, bangles, neck chains, inner wares and other beauty products and accessories. She has been running this business for the past year. With her first loan of Ksh 20,000 from Kadet Ltd she would like to buy more stock of these items to sell.

Her monthly income right now is Kshs. 8,000, and she plans to use the increased profits of her business to educate her children, expand her business and to open another business.

She hopes that the future of her business and her family will be prosperous.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of ladies jewellery to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anna Rebeca

texts.es: Anna de 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo de 7 años. Tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa nueva dentro del mercado  central del municipio. Anna es muy conocida y bien recomendada en la zona. Su principal patrimonio es su casa que con muchas dificultades ha levantado junto a su esposo.  Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, polines y clavos para  reparar el techo de su humilde casa el cual se encuentra dañada y cuando llueve sus pocas pertenencias se humedecen.
texts.en:
Anna is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and seven year old son. For 20 years she has sold new clothing in the municipality's central market. Anna is well known and respected in the area.
