Her major business challenges include electricity which hinders her business operations. She is aspiring of getting a fully stocked beauty salon and also,  permanent business premises.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of hair treatments, weaves, relaxers and braids.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married with three children, one of whom goes to school. She has no additional family members. She sells secondhand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for many years. She works six days a week. She earns additional income from operating a grocery shop. She has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of secondhand clothes and sugar, rice and soap for her grocery store. Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy season), which hinders her movements and transportation. She aspires to find a permanent residence.  She resides in a rented house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Desire

texts.en:
Desire is 30 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Desire has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap and salt. 

To help expand her business, Desire has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items for the shop such as sugar and salt to sell, and will help Desire to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Desire hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Desire is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Desire who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more items for the shop such as sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is 38 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has 4 children who are currently in school. For the past 8 years, Milly has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap and salt. 

To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items for the shop, such as sugar and salt, to sell. The loan will help Milly generate greater profits, improve her family's standards of living, and pay for her children's school fees. 

Milly hopes that in the future, she will be able to be a productive woman. 

Milly is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Milly who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more items for the shop, such as sugar and salt, to sell.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, all who are currently in school. For the past five years, Hasan has been working hard to manage his boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Hasan has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell, and will help Hasan generate greater profits, expand his business, and add additional types of clothes. Hasan hopes that in the future he will be able to produce quality products. 

Hasan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hasan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gifty's Group

texts.en:
Gifty is the featured borrower of this group. She partnered with her group members to acquire a total loan amount of GHS 3,300 from Kiva's partner, ID-Ghana. The group members have been neighbors and friends for years. 

Gifty is a 46-year-old married mother of two children. She has been selling groceries (Milo, bread, sardines, etc.) at her residence for the last seven years. Her children are at school-going ages. She is acquiring a loan amount of GHS 1,300 from Kiva's partner ID-Ghana to buy one box of Milo, bread, milk and sardines to sell to customers. 

Gifty is the second woman from the left in the picture. As for the other members, they sell beverages.

loans.use: To buy one box of Milo, bread, milk and sardines to sell to customers.

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Night is a 43-year-old single mother with five children.

Night started this business 20 years ago as source of income after she divorced her husband; she needed to find a means of survival for her and her children, since the bread winner had left them for another woman. 

She has hopes of expanding her business into wholesale to increase her income so that she can be able to provide for her children. Her business is strategically located. 

Night‘s major challenge is lack of enough stock in her shop, which takes away her customers because sometimes they ask for products she doesn’t have and loses customers to her immediate competitors.  So she wants to be funded to boost up her business and retain her customers.

She is asking for a loan of one million five hundred thousand (1,500,000) to enable her buy more stock of daily house hold use items like salt, sugar, soap, toiletries among others to meet the needs of her customers. She is hard working.

loans.use: To buy retail stock items to sell

loans.name: Roly

texts.es: Roly, de 40 años, está casada y tiene tres hijas con quienes vive en su casa propia. Roly, tiene como actividad principal la venta de techos de madera. Tiene instalado un taller rudimentario de fabricación de este producto y continuamente elaboran la cantidad necesaria para poder venderlos. Generalmente sus ventas son hechas por pedidos anticipados cuya cantidad en volumen siempre favorece su economía. La materia prima lo obtiene de madereras quienes le ofertan a precios cómodos. Todo el proceso de fabricación es manual. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 3 años y trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo. Le apasiona el trabajo que realiza porque siente que con ello contribuye a la conservación del medio ambiente, además le agrada saber que con esta labor puede obtener los ingresos económicos que necesita para apalear los gastos básicos de su familia. Espera poder implementar un taller semi-industrial donde elabore productos de mejor acabado. Este es su sexto crédito con Kiva, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.Con el préstamo de 1400 nuevos soles, comprará más restos de madera para elaborar esteras.
texts.en:
Roly is 40 years old, married, and has three children with whom she lives in her home. Roly's main business activity is selling wooden roofs. She has set up a basic workshop to manufacture this product, and works constantly to make the necessary quantity to sell. In general, she receives advance orders for her products, the volume of which always supports her income.

She obtains her raw material from the wood industry, who offer her a good price. The entire process is a manual one. She has been in this business for around three years, and is helped in her work by her husband, She is passionate about her work because she feels that she is protecting the environment through it, and she likes knowing that this job allows her to earn the money she needs to pay for the basic expenses of her family.   

She hopes to be able to set up a semi-industrial workshop where she can make products with a better finish. This is her sixth loan with Kiva, and she would like to thank those who enable her to access this loan, because it will allow her to feel more certain that she can progress in her work. She also promises to make her loan repayments on time. With the loan of 1400 soles,she will buy more pieces of wood to make matting.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Blanca Miriam

texts.es:
La señora Blanca de 47 años, es una mujer emprendedora  a  la edad de  12 años, al lado  se su abuela aprendió a elaborar artesanías  en barro, sus estudios los concluyo  a nivel de  3° grado, por la pobreza de su familia se dedicó a apoyar a su madre  en los oficios domésticos; su  única hija tiene 20 años  y  actualmente vive con ella, ya que le ayuda con la elaboración de artesanías.  

Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde los 12 años  y maneja muy bien la comercialización  de los  productos que elabora, los materiales que utiliza los compra en la ciudad ubicada a 15 minutos en pick up.  

El préstamo será utilizado, para la compra de pintura, barro y el pago de mano  de obra,  para terminar los productos 


En el futuro desea tener  un local adecuado,  en la ciudad donde pueda comercializar sus productos de manera directa  y generar mayor ganancia que le ayuden a ella  y a su hija a salir adelante, ya que son mujeres luchadoras que a pesar de ser madres solteras,  se esfuerzan día con día para tener  una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Blanca, 47, is an enterprising woman. When she was twelve, she learned how to make handicrafts in clay from her grandmother. She studied up to the third grade; her family was too poor and she started helping her mother with the household chores. Her only daughter is twenty years old and lives with her; she helps her with the handicrafts.

Blanca has had this activity since she was twelve years old and is very good at selling the products she makes. She buys the materials in a city located fifteen minutes away by car. She will use this loan to buy paints, clay and to pay for the labor needed to finish her products.

In the future, she would like to have an equipped establishment in the city, where she can sell her products directly to her customers and receive better profits that help her and her daughter to get ahead. They are hardworking women that despite being single mothers work hard every day to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy paints and clay, and to pay for the labor needed to finish her products.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es una excelente estudiante de la carrera de Derecho, ella comenta que con su esfuerzo y sacrificio está siendo una de las mejores.
Ella tiene como meta poder servir a la comunidad y ayudar a las personas que necesiten de ella, quiere ser una buena profesional que no solo piense en generar ingresos, sino que también quiera ayudar a las demás personas.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en comprar sus útiles de universidad, como así también para sus gastos de manutención. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, la cual le permitirá seguir con sus estudios y luchando por una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Laura studies Law and is an excellent student. She says that she is one of the best thanks to her hard work and sacrifice.

One of her goals is to serve her community and help people who might need her. She wants to become a professional who is not only thinking of her income, but also helping others.

She is requesting a loan to buy study supplies and to cover some of her expenses. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving, which will help her to continue with her studies and fight to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy study supplies and cover living expenses.

loans.name: Ladiri (Honnêteté) Group

texts.fr:
Ladiri est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans, sont mariées et au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, vente de tissus et divers etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe. 
Kadia  2 eme assise de la gauche vers la droite, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des colis de tissus. Elle se procure de ces articles à Koutiala et à Bobo Dioulasso au Burkina Faso. Elle vend ces articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Ladiri comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 155 500CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Kadia compte réaliser  165 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Ladiri is a group of women from Koutialia who live in extended traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They have an average age of 32, are married and have at least 5 children. This group of women sells various items such as fabrics. The members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program in order to increase the size of their businesses and are on their 7th group loan.

Kadia, sitting second from the left in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy bales of fabric. She gets them in Koutiala and Bobo Dioulasso, in Burkina Faso. She sells the fabric for cash at her home and at the market to a diverse retail clientèle. Whereas the other members of the Ladiri group expect to make an average monthly profit of 155 500 francs during this loan cycle, Kadia expects to make an average of 165 000 francs. As well as using it to repay their loans, the group members use part of their income to cover daily expenses and part of it to increase their working capital.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Sabougnouma (La Bonne Cause) Group

texts.fr:
Sabougnouma est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, sont mariées et au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, vente de tissus, de condiments, des cosmétiques, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Batoma  1 ere assise de la droite vers la gauche compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une balle de friperie pour enfants. Elle se procure de cet article au à Koutiala et effectue ses ventes en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Sabougnouma comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 57 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Batoma  compte réaliser  60 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Sabougnouma is a group of women from Koutialia who know each other well and live in extended traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They have an average age of 38, are married and have at least 4 children. This group of women sells various items like fabrics, condiments and beauty products. The members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program in order to increase the size of their businesses and are on their 1st group loan.

Batoma, sitting on the far right in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy a bale of children's clothing. She will get the clothing in Koutiala and make her sales, for cash, at her home and at the market to a diverse retail clientèle. Whereas the other members of the Sabougnouma group expect to make an average monthly profit of 57 000 francs each during this loan cycle, Batoma expects to make an average of 60 000 francs. The group members use part of their income to cover daily expenses and part of it to increase their working capital, as well as to repay their loans.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Kelegna (Union) Group

texts.fr:
Kelegna est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Sincina plateau de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, sont mariées avec en moyenne 6 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, vente de fruits et légumes, de tissus, de cosmétique, de la restauration, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe. 
Lalaicha  est un membre du groupe Kelegna, assise  a  en bazin rouge sang qui fait la vente  de tubercules, des fruits et des légumes.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des sacs de légumes, de patate, de poivron et d’igname. Elle se procure de ces articles à Koutiala et environs. Elle vend ces articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kelegna comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 135 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Lalaicha compte réaliser  160 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Kelegna is a group of women from the Sincina district of Koutialia who know each other well and live in extended traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They have an average age of 38, are married and have an average of 6 children each. This group of women sells various items like fruit and vegetables, fabrics, beauty products and prepared food. The members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program in order to increase the size of their businesses and are on their 7th group loan.

Lalaicha is a member of the Kelegna group. She is the one wearing the blood red damask outfit in the picture and she sells tubers, fruits and vegetables. She plans to use her loan to buy bags of vegetables (potatoes, peppers and yams). She will get her supplies in Koutiala and the surrounding area. She makes her sales, for cash, at her home and at the market to a diverse retail clientèle. Whereas the other members of the Kelegna group expect to make an average monthly profit of 135 000 francs each during this loan cycle, Lalaicha expects to make an average monthly profit of 160 000 francs. The group members use part of their income to cover their daily expenses and part of it to increase their working capital, as well as to repay their loans.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah lives in New Kru Town; she is 30 years old and single with four children aged between three and 13 years. They are in school and live at home. For the past five years, she has been operating a small shop where she sells soap, tissue, copy book, soft drinks, and many items. She says that some time buying goes slow. Deborah says she started this business by selling around in the communities with the little goods she would afford, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods (soap, tissue, copy book, soft drinks and many items) for her business; her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more goods (soap, tissue, copy book, soft drinks, and many items) for her retail business.

loans.name: Renale

texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Renale from Liberia precisely lives in New Kru town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are bit difficult due to the high rate of crime, fewer bathrooms, filthy conditions, and over population, but the most interesting part is that rooms are bit cheaper providing an option of traveling. Interestingly, it contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia, which leads to the reduced price of food.
 
Renale is married with three children between 11 and 18 years, who are in school and live at home. Over the past eight years, she has been operating a table business; she started this business with money from her mother, and learned this way of selling from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar, garlic, rice, butter, etc. for her business. Her plan is to move from the table business to shop.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, garlic, rice, butter, etc. for her food market business.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne  26 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  SIENSO, un des quartiers du cercle de SAN (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  et produits divers.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe  DANAYA sont à leur 13 eme  prêt solidaire. BEMAN 2 eme personne  de la gauche vers la droite  compte utiliser son prêt  pour acheter, des poivres, des tomates fraîches, des oignons, des aubergines,  et bien d’autres  paniers de  légumes. 
 Elles s’approvisionnent à San avec les paysans venus dans les villages environnants. Elles effectuent ses ventes, à  SAN et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Danaya group are 26 years old on average, and have an average of three children. They all live in traditional extended families in Sienso, one of the neighbourhoods in the cercle of San (in the 4th administrative region of Mali).

The women are all related and are involved in trading food products, such as condiments, and other goods.

Having successfully repaid all their previous loans, the women in the Danaya group are requesting their 13th solidarity loan. 

Beman, pictured second from the left, is intending to use her loan to buy peppers, fresh tomatoes, aubergines and other baskets of vegetables.

The women buy their supplies in San from farmers from the surrounding villages. They sell their goods in San and at local stalls to individual customers for cash or on credit. Their clientele includes both men and women. 

They are hoping to make a monthly average of 50 000 CFA francs, which will be spent on healthcare, food, school fees and reinvesting in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Kanouya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe KANOUYA ont en moyenne  42 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  TOMINIAN, (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  et produits divers.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe KANOUYA sont à leur 8 eme  prêt solidaire. BEMADETE 2 eme personne de la gauche vers la droite compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1bidon d’huile alimentaire, des poivres, des tomates fraîches, des oignons, des aubergines, des paniers de grains de céréales et de légumes. 
 Elles s’approvisionnent à Tominian. Elles effectuent ses ventes, à TOMINIAN au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Dans le futur elle compte payer un réfrigérateur pour la vente des boissons et jus.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Kanouya group are 42 years old on average, and have an average of five children. They all live in traditional extended families in Tominian (in the 4th administrative region of Mali).

The women are all related and are involved in trading food products, such as condiments, and other goods.

Having successfully repaid all their previous loans, the women in the Kanouya group are requesting their 8th solidarity loan. 

Bemadete, pictured second from the left, is intending to use her loan to buy one can of cooking oil, peppers, fresh tomatoes, onions, aubergines, and baskets of cereals and other vegetables.

The women buy their supplies in Tominian. They sell their goods in Tominian to men and women customers for cash or on credit. In the future, Bemadete is hoping to buy a refrigerator so she can sell juice and other drinks.

The women are hoping to make a monthly average of 50 000 CFA francs, which will be spent on healthcare, food, school fees and reinvesting in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy produce.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BADEGNA ont en moyenne  37 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  KANCENE, un village du cercle de Tominian (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  et produits divers.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BADEGNA sont à leur 3 eme  prêt solidaire. BINTOU SOLO 2 eme personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite compte utiliser son prêt  pour acheter, 1bales de tissus, des chaussures, des tomates fraîches, des oignons, des aubergines, des paniers de grains de céréales et quelques  paniers de fruits et légumes. 
 Elles s’approvisionnent à KANCENE. Elles effectuent ses ventes, à KANCENE, au marché et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Badegna group are 37 years old on average, and have an average of five children. They all live in traditional extended families in Kancene, a village in the cercle of Tominian (in the 4th administrative region of Mali).

The women are all related and are involved in trading food products, such as condiments, and other goods.

Having successfully repaid all their previous loans, the women in the Badegna group are requesting their 3rd solidarity loan. 

Bintou Solo, pictured standing second from the left, intends to use her loan to buy one bale of cloth, shoes, fresh tomatoes, onions, aubergines, baskets of cereals and some baskets of fruit and vegetables.

The women buy their supplies in Kancene. They sell their goods in Kancene at the market and local stalls to individual customers for cash or on credit. Their clientele includes both men and women. 

They are hoping to make a monthly average of 30 000 CFA francs, which will be spent on healthcare, food, school fees and reinvesting in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy various items.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJEKAFO ont en moyenne  45 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  KANCENE, un des villages de Tominian (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  et produits divers.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur 4 er  prêt solidaire. AWA 2 ère personne  assise   à  gauche en foulard blanc   au coud sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt  pour acheter,  5 sacs d’arachide, des poivres, des tomates fraîches, des oignons, des aubergines, des paniers de grains de céréales. 
 Elles s’approvisionnent à Tominian. Elles effectuent ses ventes, à KANCENE et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Djekafo group are 45 years old on average, and have an average of five children. They all live in traditional extended families in Kancene, a village in the cercle of Tominian (in the 4th administrative region of Mali).

The women are all related and are involved in trading food products, such as condiments, and other goods.

Having successfully repaid all their previous loans, the women in the Djekafo group are requesting their 4th solidarity loan. 

AWA, pictured sitting second from the left wearing a white scarf, intends to use her loan to buy five sacks of groundnuts, peppers, fresh tomatoes, onions, aubergines and baskets of cereal grains.

The women buy their supplies in Tominian. They sell their goods in Kancene and at local stalls to individual customers for cash or on credit. Their clientele includes both men and women. 

They are hoping to make a monthly average of 20 000 CFA francs, which will be spent on healthcare, food, school fees and reinvesting in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy produce.

loans.name: Weatha

texts.en: Weatha lives in New Kru town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are bit difficult due to the high rate of crime, fewer bathrooms, filthy conditions, and over population, but the most interesting part is that rooms are bit cheaper, providing an option of traveling and containing one of the biggest markets in Liberia resulting in the reduced rates for food. Weatha is 41-years-old, married with five children age between three to 21 years old. They are in school and live at home. For the past four years, she has been operating a table market right in front of her house where she sells cold water and doughnuts. She started this business with money from her mother, and learned this way of selling from her aunty. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cold water, flour, sugar, salt, etc. for her business. Her plan is to move from the table business to a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more cold water, flour, sugar, salt, etc. for her food business.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne  34 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  KANCENE, un des villages du cercle de Tominian (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  et produits divers.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur 4 eme  prêt solidaire. BAOULA 1 ère personne debout  de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt  pour acheter,  20 sacs d’arachide, des paniers de poivres, tomates fraîches, oignons, aubergines et des paniers de grains de céréales. Elles s’approvisionnent à KANCENE. Elles effectuent ses ventes, à KANCENE et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Danaya group are 34 years old on average, and have an average of three children. They all live in traditional extended families in Kancene, a village in the cercle of Tominian (in the 4th administrative region of Mali).

The women are all related and are involved in trading food products, such as condiments, and other goods.

Having successfully repaid all their previous loans, the women in the Danaya group are requesting their 4th solidarity loan. 

Baoula, pictured standing on the far right, intends to use her loan to buy 20 sacks of groundnuts, baskets of peppers, fresh tomatoes, onions, aubergines and baskets of cereals. 

The women buy their supplies in Kancene. They sell their goods in Kancene and at local stalls to individual customers for cash or on credit. Their clientele includes both men and women. 

The group hope to make a monthly average of 50 000 CFA francs, which will be spent on healthcare, food, school fees and reinvesting in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy produce.

loans.name: Morcen

texts.en: Morcen is 36-years-old and lives in West Point, which is one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She was unable to complete the ninth grade, but she says she is good at managing business. She is single and has two children ages one and eight, only one of them is in school and they all live at home. For the past four years, she has been selling candy, biscuits, soft drinks, oil, sugar flour, etc. from a small shop in the market. She has many customers and makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more candy, biscuits, soft drinks, oil, sugar flour, etc. for her business. She hopes to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more candy, biscuits, soft drinks, oil, sugar flour, etc. for her food market business.

loans.name: Aniata

texts.en: Aniata lives in West Point, which is one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She is 41-years-old. She did not attend school, but she engages herself in business. She is married with nine children between the ages of two and 23. Two are in school and they all live at home. For the past eight years now, she has been involved in business; presently, she sells oil, garlic, flours, etc. in the local market. She received a little amount from her mother to establish her business, and she learned this way of trading from her. She likes her business because she makes more profit; she is requesting a loan to purchase oil, garlic, flours, etc. to increase her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase oil, garlic, flours, etc. to increase her food market business.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en: Finda is 37-years-old and lives in West Point, which is one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She was unable to attend school, but she says she is good at managing business. She is single and has three children between 13 and 21, all of them are in school and live at home. For the past eight years, she has been selling candy, biscuits, soft drinks, oil, sugar flour, etc. from a small shop in the market. She has many customers and makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more candy, biscuits, soft drinks, oil, sugar, etc. for her business. She hopes to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more candy, biscuits, soft drinks, oil, sugar, etc. for her food market business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 29-years-old and lives in the West Point community, which is a populated area in Montserrado County. She is single and has a child aged 13 years. Her child is going to school, and lives at home. She did not go to school, but she is business-minded woman. Over the past four years, she has been selling coal in the local market without facing any serious problems. She started this business by selling coal for her mother. She sells six days in a week spending 10 hours each day on her business. In so doing, she is requesting for loan to purchase more coal to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase more coal to increase her sales.

loans.name: Djiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUISEME ont en moyenne  43 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  KANCENE, un des villages du cercle de Tominian (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  et produits divers.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJIGUISEME sont à leur 4 eme  prêt solidaire. FATOU 1 ère personne assise  de la gauche vers la droite,  compte utiliser son prêt  pour acheter,  1bidon d’huile alimentaire, des poivres, des tomates fraîches, des oignons, des aubergines, des paniers de grains de céréales et quelques  paniers de fruits et légumes. 
 Elles s’approvisionnent à Tominian. Elles effectuent ses ventes, à KANCENE et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguiseme group are on average 43 years old with 4 children and all live in traditional larger families in Kancene, one of the villages in Tominian (the fourth administrative region of Mali.) These women came to know each other through relatives and are in the business of purchase and resale of food products and spices, as well as other assorted items.

Having fully repaid their previous loans, the women of Djiguiseme are on their 4th group loan together. Fatou, pictured as the first person sitting from left to right in the photo, plans to use her loan proceeds to purchase 1 barrel of cooking oil, peppers, fresh tomatoes, onions, eggplants, baskets of grains and cereals, and some baskets of fruits and vegetables. She stocks up in Tominian, and makes her sales in Kancene and in the neighboring markets at retail, for both cash and credit, to a customer base made up of both men and women.

The women hope to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA each, which will be used to take care of their health needs, food, and education costs, and the rest will be reinvested in their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA ont en moyenne  37ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  KANCENE, un des villages du cercle de Tominian (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  et produits divers.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur 4 eme  prêt solidaire. MEMA 2 eme personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite,  compte utiliser son prêt  pour acheter,  5 sacs d’arachide, des poivres, des tomates fraîches, des oignons, des aubergines et des paniers de grains de céréales. 
 Elles s’approvisionnent à Tominian. Elles effectuent ses ventes, à KANCENE et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabougnouma group are on average 37 years old with 5 children and all live in traditional larger families in Kancene, one of the villages of Tominian (the fourth administrative region of Mali.) These women came to know each other through relatives and are in the business of purchasing and reselling food products and spices, as well as other assorted products. Having fully repaid their previous loans, the women of Sabougnouma are on their 4th group loan together.

Mema, the second woman pictured standing from left to right in the photo, plans to use her loan to purchase 5 bags of peanuts, peppers, fresh tomatoes, onions, eggplants, and baskets of grains and cereals. She stocks up in Tominian and makes her sales in Kancene and the neighboring markets, at retail, for both cash and credit to a customer base made up of both men and women.

Mema hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA which will be used to take care of her health needs, food, education costs, and the remainder to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Dharmradj

texts.en:
Dharmradj is 38 years old and has a family with two young children. He plants crops in his own land and has an old tractor. Rice cultivation is the only source of income for the family. In 2011, he received his first loan from Seva MFI. Since then, he has received five more loans and he has repaid those fully. 

Dharmradj has been able to finish building his house and now he needs to save money for a new tractor. Dharmradj has requested a new loan of SRD 10,000 to expand production and have more savings, so that he can buy his tractor.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides so he can expand production.

loans.name: Safiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJEKAFO ont en moyenne  34 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  KANCENE, un des villages du cercle de Tominan (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  et produits divers.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur 4 eme  prêt solidaire. SAFIATOU 2 eme personne debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ne compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 sacs d’arachide, des paniers de poivres, de tomates fraîches, d’oignons, des aubergines et des paniers de grains de céréales. 
 Elles s’approvisionnent à KANCENE. Elles effectuent ses ventes, à KANCENE et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Djekafo Group average 34 years of age and three children. They all live in traditional families in Kancene, a village in Tominan Cercle (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women got to know each other through bonds of kinship. They buy and sell food products, such as condiments, and other products.

After having repaid their previous loans without problems, the women of Djekafo Group are now seeking their fourth solidarity loan (group loan).

Safiatou is the second woman from the left in the standing row. She intends to use her part of the loan to buy 10 sacks of peanuts, baskets of pepper, fresh tomatoes, onions, eggplants, and baskets of cereals.

The women get their supplies in Kancene, and sell for cash and on credit, in Kancene and in the surrounding fairs, to a clientele comprising both women and men.

They intend to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 50'000 (ca US$ 105), to be used to cover healthcare, food, and school expenses. The remainder will be reinvested in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, pepper, tomatoes, onions, eggplants, and cereals

loans.name: Esther G.

texts.en: Esther is 49 years old and lives in the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single with four children who are in school and live at home. She is a high school graduate, and she is a business-minded woman.  For the past seven years, she has been selling fish in the local market and has not faced any serious problem so far.  She started this business by selling for her mother. She sells six days per week for 10 hours each day.  She is requesting for a loan to purchase more fish to increase her sales. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell at the market.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne  47 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  TENE, un villages du cercle de Tominian (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  et produits divers.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe sont à leur 9 eme  prêt solidaire. Bintou 1 ère personne debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des bananes, des poivres, des tomates fraîches, des oignons, des aubergines, des paniers de grains de céréales. 
Elles s’approvisionnent à TENE. Elles effectuent ses ventes, à TENE, au marché et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Benkadi Group average 47 years of age and four children. They all live in extended traditional families in Téné, a village in Tominan Cercle (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women got to know each other through bonds of kinship. They buy and sell food products, such as condiments, and other products.

After having repaid their previous loans without problems, the women of Benkadi Group are now seeking their ninth solidarity loan (group loan).

Bintou is the first woman from the left in the photograph. She intends to use her part of the loan to buy bananas, peppers, fresh tomatoes, onions, eggplants, and baskets of cereals.

The women get their supplies in Téné, and sell for cash and on credit, at the market in Téné and in the surrounding fairs, to a clientele comprising both women and men.

They intend to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 50'000 (ca US$ 105), to be used to cover healthcare, food, and school expenses. The remainder will be reinvested in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy bananas, peppers, tomatoes, onions, eggplants, and cereals

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia is 34 years old and married with 6 children. She makes and sells two-piece Puletasi dresses, shirts and men's pocket Sulu to earn a living and has been doing this for 4 years. Telesia has requested a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine, fabrics, needles and threads.  She plans to use her profits to increase her sewing business and support her family. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabrics, needles and threads.

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en: Lesina is 37 years old and single with 4 children. She has a flea market where she sells local handicrafts such as earrings, kava bowls, fine mats, and Samoan fans to local people and tourists. She has requested a loan to buy Samoan bags, kava bowls, pandanus leaves, earrings, paints, elei materials and tapa cloth. Lesina will use her profits to improve her flea market and help her family's needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2007.

loans.use: to buy Samoan bags, kava bowls, pandanus leaves, earrings, paints, elei materials and  tapa cloth.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 23 years old and married with 4 children. She owns and operates a fabric painting business venture called Elei.  She has 2 years of experience in this line of work.  Rosita needs a loan to buy fabrics, fabric paint, brushes, stencils, an Elei carved board, gloves and an art paint roller. She hopes to use her profits to provide for her family's daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, fabric paint, brushes, stencils, an Elei carved board, gloves and an art paint roller.

loans.name: Faamelea

texts.en:
Faamelea, 52, is married with 9 children. 

She has a small garden where she grows pineapples that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Faamelea needs a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, pickaxe, bushknife, water gallon and gloves.

She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. Faamelea will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, pickaxe, bushknife, water gallon and gloves.

loans.name: Uai

texts.en: Uai is 42 years old and married with four children. She runs a retail shop and has been doing this for two years. Uai has requested a loan to buy a beverage display cooler, hot water urn, and pairs of sandals. She joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Uai will provide for family daily needs.

loans.use: to buy a beverage display cooler, hot water urn, and pairs of sandals

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en: Henrietta, 60, is married and lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental along with her family. She helps her husband to operate their own farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in business for ten years. Her harvest was good enough to pay her previous loan from GDMPC. She borrowed a new loan to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: Claudia es una ama de casa de 28 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos de 3 y 8 años. Debido a la falta de oportunidades laborales y, con el ánimo de generar ingresos por cuenta propia, desea iniciar su propio negocio de producción y venta de arepas, así aprovechará al máximo el conocimiento y la experiencia obtenida en un empleo anterior y en el curso de capacitación que realizó. La idea inicial es adecuar un espacio de la casa donde reside, aprovechando que tiene el espacio suficiente para hacerlo y así, podrá estar a cargo de todas las labores de su hogar al mismo tiempo que trabaja. Requiere el apoyo del crédito para comprar un molino, insumos al por mayor (maíz y bolsas para empaque), realizar publicidad y hacer las adecuaciones del espacio, de esta manera podrá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo, del que espera buenos resultados y así poder apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. Claudia, con su espíritu de superación, su proyección y su empuje siempre encuentra la manera de salir adelante, lo que le permite soñar con hacer crecer su negocio, convertirlo en una fuente de ingresos rentable y perdurable en el tiempo, para que en un futuro le de la oportunidad de ahorrar y adquirir su casa propia, lo que para ella significaría brindar un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Claudia is a 28 year old housewife who lives with her husband and two young children, ages 3 and 8.  Given the lack of work opportunities, and with a desire to generate income on her own, she wants to start her own business, making and selling cornbread.  This way she can take maximum advantage of the knowledge and experience she got from a previous employer and a training course she took.  Her initial idea is to set up an area in her home, so she can take advantage of the space.  This way she can still do all the housework and work at the same time.  She needs this loan to buy a grinder, supplies in quantity (corn and bags for packaging), advertise, and set up the space.  This way she will be able to start her project.  She expects good results and in this way she can help her husband with the household expenses.  Claudia, with her spirit of success, projection, and self-motivation, always looks for ways to get ahead.  This allows her to dream about growing her business, turn it into a profitable and lasting source of income, so that she can buy a house in the future.  To her, this means improving her family’s wellbeing and quality of life.

loans.use: to set up a work area and buy supplies.

loans.name: Tuvaelagi

texts.en:
Tuvaelagi is 34 years old and married, with one child. 

She has a small vegetable garden, and she grows cabbages, cucumbers, and tomatoes to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Tuvaelagi has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a garden hose, a rake, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, gloves, and a shovel. 

She has been a member of SPBD in 2013. With her profits, Tuvaelagi hopes to expand her business.
"

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds,a garden hose, a rake, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, gloves, and a shovel

loans.name: Vaeono

texts.en: Vaeono is a 61-year-old woman who is married with  four children. She runs a business selling variety of goods in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. Vaeono has requested a loan to buy boxes of chicken, noodles, rice, sugar, flour, snacks, toilet rolls, cigarettes and milk. She plans to use her profits to save for children's education and provide for her family financially. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken, noodles, rice, sugar, flour, snacks, toilet rolls, cigarettes and milk

loans.name: Ulalia

texts.en:
Ulalia is 46 years old, married and has three children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 1 year. 

Ulalia has requested a loan to buy flour, a sack of sugar, dripping oil, a frying pan, baking powder and a baking spoon. 

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Ulalia will assist her family financially.

loans.use: to buy flour, a sack of sugar, dripping oil, a frying pan, baking powder and a baking spoon.

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Cherry Mae works hard to support her family.

She sells ornamental plants in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from blacksmithing. 

Cherry Mae successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like flower pots, wire, rope, fertilizer, etc. for her business.

Cherry Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like flower pots, wire, rope, fertilizer, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Sinuu

texts.en:
Sinuu is a 54-year-old married woman with nine children.
 
She has a small vegetable garden and grows cabbages, tomatoes and pumpkins to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Sinuu has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, chemicals, barbed wire, a water hose and vegetable seeds.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Sinuu hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, chemicals, barbed wire, a water hose and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Evylyn

texts.en:
Evylyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like salt, rice, sugar, meat, etc., for her food-vending business.

Evylyn has been in this business for eight years. Evylyn earns more income from a general store.

Evylyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like salt, rice, sugar, meat, etc., for her business

loans.name: Manuel José

texts.es: Manuel se ha dedicado durante 20 años a trabajar como comerciante independiente, aprendió la labor con algunos amigos que se dedicaban a ésto y, poco a poco fue adquiriendo conocimientos y experiencia para desenvolverse en este campo. Inició su negocio propio en el pueblo donde vivía, un almacén de venta de repuestos y autopartes para vehículos, pero, luego de algunos años, se trasladó para la ciudad con su familia y allí, ya radicado, abrió nuevamente su negocio en un local bien ubicado, en un sector de gran afluencia de personas, por lo que le ha dado buenos resultados. Su empuje,empeño y dedicación, le han permitido salir siempre adelante, sobrepasando las adversidades que se le interponen en el camino, sin embargo, hoy en día, con 48 años de edad, se siente con más fuerzas y motivación para seguir avanzando. Solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar accesorios, repuestos y lujos para los vehículos (bujías, pistones, rines, llantas, manubrio, luces de led, entre otros), así tendrá su negocio bien surtido para satisfacer la demanda y poder satisfacer los diversos gustos de sus clientes, lo que dará como resultado un incremento en las ventas y en los ingresos que recibe. Manuel desea seguir trabajando arduamente para llegar a cumplir el sueño de fortalecer su negocio y abrirse paso para montar una nueva sucursal, que le permita generar oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo y su esposa.
texts.en:
Manuel has been an independent trader for twenty years. He learned this work with some friends who do the same, and bit by bit acquired more knowledge and experience to develop his skills and advance in this sector. 

He started his own business in the town where he was living, a warehouse where he sold vehicle parts and replacements. But some years later, he moved to the city with his family. There, once he got settled, he reopened his business in a well-located space, in an area that gets a lot of traffic, which has given him good results.

His drive, determination, and dedication have helped him to always get ahead, overcoming the hardships that have come his way. Today, at 48 years of age, he feels stronger and more motivated to continue advancing. He requests the support of a loan to buy vehicle accessories, replacement parts and luxury items (spark plugs, pistons, rims, tires, handlebars, led lights, etc). This will allow him to have his business well-equipped to fulfill demand and be able to satisfy the various tastes of his clients, which will lead to an increase in sales and in the income he receives.

Manuel wants to continue working hard to be able to fulfill his dream of strengthening his business and clearing the way to start an new branch, which will allow him to create job opportunities and improve his son and wife's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vehicle accessories, replacement parts and luxury items (spark plugs, pistons, rims, tires, handlebars, led lights, etc).

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es: Luz es una mujer de 46 años de edad, madre de 2 hijos y cabeza de hogar luego de haberse separado de su esposo. Durante muchos años ha trabajado como comerciante independiente y, actualmente tiene una distribuidora de productos desechables, ubicado en una zona muy transitada del municipio donde reside, trabaja sola todos los días de la semana, de 8:00 am a 8:00 pm y, de esta manera genera los recursos necesarios para llevar el sustento a su hogar. La cliente se caracteriza por su empuje, su carisma y nobleza, virtudes que le han permitido salir siempre adelante. Actualmente solicita su cuarto ciclo de crédito con el cual desea comprar surtido al por mayor (vasos, platos, cubiertos, bolsas para empaque, artículos en icopor), con lo que tendrá inventario suficiente para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, además podrá ampliar el portafolio con nuevas marcas y productos innovadores para ofrecer a su clientela mayor variedad, dando como resultado un mejoramiento notable en la entrada de recursos económicos para su familia. Luz sueña con seguir luchando con esmero y dedicación, para fortalecer y acreditar su negocio y, en un futuro cercano tener la oportunidad de ampliarlo y ser una distribuidora mayorista. Esto le permitirá dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en: Luz is 46 years old, the mother of 2 children, and has been head of her household since she separated from her husband.  She has worked as an independent merchant for many years and currently sells disposable products in a tourist area of her town.  She only works a few days a week, from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm and generates necessary income for her household.  She is known for her drive, honesty, and virtue that has allowed her to get ahead.  She is asking for her fourth loan so she can buy supplies in quantity (cups, plates, flatware, packing bags, and other items) so that she will have enough inventory to satisfy her customer demand, that will increase over the approaching Christmas season.  She also wants to increase the number of brands and products so she can offer her customers a greater variety.  This will provide a notable improvement in her family finances.  Luz dreams of continuing to work with enthusiasm and dedication, to strengthen and legitimize her business.  She wants to have the opportunity to expand it in the future and become a large distributer.  This will allow her to provide better conditions and wellbeing for her children.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 23-year-old single woman. She describes herself as motivated. 

She operates a clothes store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area good for business. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of enough funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of clothes for resale. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel in business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Suiga

texts.en:
Suiga is a 50-year-old married woman with three children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Suiga has requested a loan to buy chemicals, taro root crops, barbed wire, a wheelbarrow, bush-knives and a backpack sprayer. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Suiga hopes to improve her business to get more income.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, taro root crops, barbed wire, a wheelbarrow, bush knives and a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is a 36-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 4 years and 6 years. He describes himself as focused. 

He operates a farm where he grows maize to sell. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a rural area. He describes his biggest business challenge as price fluctuations. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more maize and other cereals to sell. His business goal is to be a major supplier of grains within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will get good returns. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more maize and other cereals to sell.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 42 years old, married and has six children. 

She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Juanita has requested a loan to buy spears, snorkels, goggles, life jackets, fishing net and a cooler. 

She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Juanita will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spears, snorkels, goggles, life jackets, fishing net and a cooler.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita works hard to support her family. Conchita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Conchita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Conchita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Talalelei

texts.en:
Talalelei is a 69-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years.Talalelei has requested a loan to buy weedkiller, a wheelbarrow, a water gallon container, bushknives, barbed wire and thick farmer boots.

She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits,Talalelei hopes to provide for her family financially.

loans.use: to buy weedkiller, wheelbarrow, water gallon container, bushknives, barbed wire and thick farmer boots

loans.name: Siitu

texts.en:
Siitu is a 25-year-old lady with  no children. She has a small garden where she grows pineapples that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Siitu needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a rake, shovels, gloves and a garden hose. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. Siitu will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a rake, shovels, gloves and a garden hose

loans.name: Naama

texts.en:
Naama is 27 years old, single and has two children. 

She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Naama has requested a loan to buy fishing nets, canoe and a cooler. 

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Naama will improve her business to earn more money.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, canoe and a cooler.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 27 years old, married, and has one child. She operates a grocery store, selling fruits and vegetables, which she has been doing for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

Jane is requesting her second loan from SMEP DTM for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy stocks of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to be financially stable within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Elesi

texts.en:
Elesi is 44 years old and married, with two children. 

She runs a small business selling ice-cake and pork buns in her community, and she has been doing this for many years. 

Elesi has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, soy sauce, garlic, onions, salt, cordials, sugar, and foam cups. 

She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Elesi will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, soy sauce, garlic, onions, salt, cordials, sugar, and foam cups

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emilia is 53 years old and has three children.

Emilia has a dried-fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Emilia requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

In the future, Emilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Patouli

texts.en:
Patouli is 43  years old, a young woman with one child. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Patouli needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a rake, shovels, gloves, bush-knives, and a garden hose.

She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. Patouli will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a rake, shovels, gloves and a garden hose

loans.name: Elenoa

texts.en: Elenoa is 28 years old and married with no children. She owns and operates a business venture, Elei. She has two years of experience in this line of business. Elena needs a loan to buy materials, fabric paints, a stencil, an 'elei' carved board, and a paint roller. She hopes to use her profits to provide for family daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy materials, fabric paints, a stencil, an 'elei' carved board and a paint roller

loans.name: Sarona

texts.en: Sarona is 36 years old and married  with six children. She wants to start an 'elei' (block printing on fabrics) business. To do this, she needs a loan to buy fabrics, fabric  paints, stencils, a paint roller and thread. In the future, Sarona hopes to save for her children's  school fees. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, fabric paints, stencils, a paint roller and thread

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela works hard to support her family. Angela is married and has a  business buying and selling spare parts in the Philippines.

Angela requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional spare parts to sell.

Angela has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Angela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts to sell

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
Cesaria is 49 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Cesaria has a general store business in the Philippines. Cesaria requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, shampoo, fabric conditioners, cream, coffee, sugar, bath soap, etc. to sell.

Cesaria has been in this business for five years. Cesaria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, shampoo, fabric conditioners, cream, coffee, sugar, bath soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a married woman, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Juliana is 54 years old and her three children are in school.

Juliana has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Juliana has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as ambitious. 

Simon operates a farm where he grows carrots and potatoes. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in an area that is conducive to farming and his primary customers are retailers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be that, during rain season, transportation is a problem. 

Simon will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, and other farm inputs. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will give his family the best. 

This is Simon's first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 27 years old and married, with one child. She runs a small business, selling fried chicken, sausages, curry, and rice in her community and she has been doing this for many years. 

Marieta has requested a loan to buy boxes of chicken, sausage, curry powder, garlic, onion, salt, oil, and rice. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Marieta will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken, sausage, curry powder, garlic, onion, salt, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe LAIDOU ont en moyenne  38 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  TENE, un des villages du cercle de Tominian (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  et produits divers.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe LAIDOU sont à leur 9 eme  prêt solidaire. AWA  2 ère personne debout de la droite vers la gauche, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, oranges, bananes, des poivres, des tomates fraîches, des oignons, des aubergines, des paniers de grains de céréales. 
 Elles s’approvisionnent à TENE. Elles effectuent ses ventes, à TENE  et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group LAIDOU average 38 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional extended families in TENE, a village in Cercle de Tominian (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through kinship ties, and they have businesses buying and selling grocery items, such as condiments and a variety of goods. After having correctly paid back the previous loans, the women of the group LAIDOU are now on their ninth solidarity loan. 

AWA, who is the second person standing from the right in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase oranges, bananas, pears, fresh tomatoes, onions, eggplant, and baskets of grains. She gets her supplies in TENE, and she makes her sales there too and at the surrounding fairs to men and women customers paying with cash or on credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, and schooling. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies to sell

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
Arcelita is 50 years old and married with two children. Arcelita works very hard to provide for them.

Arcelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, laundry soap, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store.

Arcelita has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, laundry soap, noodles, etc. 

Arcelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, laundry soap, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support herself. She is single and has a banana vending business in the Philippines.

Letecia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lodelita

texts.en:
Lodelita is a married woman, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lodelita is 39 years old and her four children are in school.

Lodelita has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like eggs, soy sauce, sugar, coffee, detergent soap, and hair conditioner.

Lodelita has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like eggs, soy sauce, sugar, coffee, detergent soap, and hair conditioner.

loans.name: María Blanca

texts.es: María, a sus 62 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una legumbrería que inició hace varios años como una alternativa para aportar a la economía de su hogar, pues su esposo era quien llevaba toda la carga económica y suplía las necesidades tanto de ella, como de sus 3 hijos. Allí labora todos los días de la semana y ofrece mucha diversidad de frutas y verduras, con lo que genera los ingresos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo. Ella manifiesta que su edad no es ningún impedimento para seguir haciendo lo que le gusta, pues de esta manera se siente útil mientras genera ingresos para su hogar. Solicita el crédito como una oportunidad para invertir en la compra de surtido al por mayor (frutas y verduras en cosecha), lo que le permitirá tener más variedad de alimentos disponibles y así satisfacer la demanda de sus compradores. María desea seguir fortaleciendo y acreditando su negocio, pues se ha convertido en una buena fuente de ingresos y sueña con adquirir un local comercial propio para montar su negocio, con lo que podrá brinda a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
María is 62 years old and makes a living with her own business: a fruits and vegetables shop that she started a few years ago in order to support the household.  Previously María's husband was the only one bringing home an income and paying for everything that María and their three children needed.  María works in the shop every day and offers a variety of fruits and vegetables.  This generates enough of an income to support her husband.

María tells us that her age does not slow her down and she continues doing the work she likes.  It is with this work that María feels useful as she earns an income for the household.  María is applying for this loan to invest in buying stock (seasonal fruits and vegetables) in bulk.  This will allow María to have a greater variety of stock available, and to satisfy her customers' demands.  María would like to continue strengthening her business.  It has become a good source of income and María dreams of having her owns premises to move her business to.  Then she would be able to give her children a better quality of life and improve their well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock in bulk (seasonal fruits and vegetables).

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es:
Silveria de 38 años, estudio hasta sexto en el municipio, para llegar a la escuela,  tenía que trasladar se todos los días a pie, desde su casa son como 5 kilómetros y para  llegar temprano salía de su casa a las 6:00 am , por veredas para acortar el camino y por la tarde tenía que hacer el mismo recorrido. El esposo se dedica a la agricultura desde su niñez, el papá le enseño a trabajar muy duro de esta manera,  lleva el sustento a su hogar, tiene tres hijos los cuales viven junto a ella todos están estudiando.
